column6: Julianna was the best!!!!! The food was so good and not over priced. Good ambience and great details. We enjoyed the birthday brunch here. Only one thing that threw us of was the hostess. She need to be more communicative and friendly also put on some smile on her face, I assume her name is Anna. Anyway love the place and this is only suggestion for the better. Please don't be mad.

This is a fairly typical Brooklyn hipster-ish place.  We did like it, though.  Four of us (plus infant) came in for a Sunday brunch.  We had reservations and were seated right away.  Service was good.  Again, typical for the area, it was on the small side and I felt a little cramped, but it did have some outdoor seating also.  I had a mushroom omelet and an Americano.  All the food was OK, not really great.  Pricing was high, even for this part of Brooklyn.  So, overall OK, but I would not seek it out again.

I enjoyed the ambiance and art deco vibes. I was a little disappointed in the food. We ordered a number of the veggie sides and they were overly greasy and the brussel sprouts felt over cooked and burned. The fava bean appetizer can be skipped completely. It's confusing and pricey. I asked for a vegetarian pasta as there were no options on the menu and they offered me spaghetti with tomato sauce. No vegetables could be added I was told. The mushroom pizza was pretty good I will say. Probably not coming back though, not vegan friendly.

Second time here at the cafe. While the pizza is obviously good the coffee shop is magic. Today the barista is super busy on a hot 90 degree sunday but she is crushing it, slaying drinks left to right. She kindly explained what a Shakerato was and made the tastiest drink. Thank you! Also y'all better be tipping!!!

The Ostriche del Giorno and Amalfitana were amazing. To be honest, we actually ended up ordering another Amlfitana we thought it was that good. The Mondeghili (not pictured) was a tad dry but still very good, we especially enjoyed the sauce it came with. The Zucchine was under cooked and pieces varied in size substantially, the Cavoletti di Bruxelles was nothing special, and would not recommend the Ravioli Pere e Gorgonzola. Overall a nice vibe and would go back again for drinks and appetizers but less likely to eat a full dinner there.

The ambiance in the main dining area is lovely, with all of the wooden interior. Service was pretty slow...it took a very long time for the food to come out. The penne vodka and sun choke soup were delicious. The pizza was good but didn't stand out.
Food was good. Ambiance was lovely. Service was shit and prices were way too high. Such a shame because the original is fantastic.

I've been in the neighborhood for over a decade and this place does not reflect friendly, community and welcoming vibes at all. Stuffy, rude, over priced, okay food. Really disappointing especially for how much I love both the food and atmosphere at the BedStuy location.

As big fans of Saraghina in Bed Stuy, we were excited to try out this location and it didn't disappoint. It's fabulous. Super cozy, staff was warm and friendly, and the food was spectacular. Highly recommend.

This place is perfection.  Have been several times and every single time the food and service is phenomenal.  The crappy reviews here make absolutely no sense whatsoever.  If I lived in Fort Greene, I would be here a couple of times a week.

I was excited to check out this place as I'm a fan of the Bedstuy location, but the experience was so bad that I won't be returning to either location. Food was just OKAY and not worth it for the price. The bartender was so rude and condescending and not to mention a flat out creep. The ambience wasn't even nice due to the cramped space. Don't waste your time with this place when there are so many great restaurants nearby (Evelina, Roman's, Walters...etc).
Data privacy issue. Gave cell number (not email) thinking it was for a table callback, email spam came immediately and unable to opt out.

Rhonda was very welcoming at the door. Greeted us right away as me and my partner walked in. Our server, Lizzie was very sweet,very personable with the drinks. We ordered the brussel sprouts, arancini and the ricotta stuffed raviolis. The brussel sprouts are a must of course if you've been to their other location. As for the arancini, I've had to order two more. That's how obsessed I was with them. Service was great from the moment I walked in. Can't wait to visit again.

The food? not seasoned. The place? beyond cramped. Hello I don't want to sit shoulder to shoulder with strangers during a pandemic. The pizza would've been good but the crust had zero flavor. Salt is your friend if you eat here. After years of learning to cook at home since The Shutdown, there's nothing on this menu you can't make for much cheaper. It would probably taste better. Ridiculous Manhattan prices for bland food in Brooklyn. Seemed like a good mixology bar but our cocktails were all one-note too. Maybe they were having an off night but we were hit with a swinging door more than once and no one even said sorry. Way too loud and uncomfortable. Don't sit at the oyster bar! Weird place.

Agree with the other reviewer about terrible service. I'm a fan of their Bed-Stuy location and was excited to try their new location out. However when I tried to get a table, I was told by the hostess that their waitlist was capped for the night.  Immediately after me, another walk-in customer asked for a table and the hostess agreed to seat them. They've lost this loyal customer - won't be going to either location again.
Lovely place, comfortable neighborhood vibe. Excellent cocktails and sea food. 5 stars!

Coffees are delicious but what an odd place - we've been in this neighborhood over 20 years and this place's style, offerings and vibe feel like such an erasure of the history and life that was here before it. We tried to remain open and have come in a bunch of times - but every time I'm greeted with such cold service, changing menus, sometimes my drink is available and other times it's not, the hosts and waitstaff don't seem to know either. We appreciate the other Saraghina which has such a community vibe and solid offerings - hope they figure out how to be good neighbors and contribute to the life of the neighborhood. This seems to be a shared sentiment by most folks we talk to in the neighborhood.

This place was horrific. I have never ever been so rudely treated. We waited for more than half an hour to be seated, which is even more ridiculous given that I was texted earlier that evening asking if I wanted to be seated early. Hostess told me, robot like, that she could not give me any information about the "situation." Wait staff could not remember any of our orders, which is concerning given that I have a sever shrimp allergy. Generally I do not understand how these people feel like it's okay to be so rude as a restaurant in nyc.

I just moved to the neighborhood and had a really nice dining experience. I had initially made the wrong reservation for the wrong # of people on resy and it wouldn't let me change it and the hostess was gracious and helped move it to three and helped to accommodate a request for an outdoor table. Granted it was 6:15 but the place fills up early as the outdoor seating is wonderful for people watching during after work / early dinner hours. The service was excellent from the waitress to the busboys. Food was milanese italian style. A bit pricey but great for a neighborhood joint. Nice cocktail list. Pace of food was properly spaced. After being in the hamptons in the summer where the service is terrible and full of pretentious assholes it was nice to be back in brooklyn with some more diversity and nice people. Definitely will be back and hope to make it a neighborhood joint. I read some of the hypercritical reviews which was not my experience. Every time I walk by it has a good crowd going. They also have many gluten free options if you need.

I wanted to love this place as I've been happily dining at the Bed Stuy location  for years but unfortunately I will not be back. Although the food was enjoyable the service left a lot to be desired. Food was forgotten, drinks were constantly left empty and the kitchen closed without our waiter asking if we wanted another item or dessert.

The food was ok, but the service is completely disorganized. We ordered drinks that took a very long time to come, and then all of our dishes came out at once, which left us with lukewarm entrees by the time we finished what was supposed to be our first course. They also forgot to bring out the crudo we ordered and brought it at the very end of the meal. Also don't let them seat you at the raw bar, it's way too close to the kitchen and people are whizzing by with plates constantly, making it way too tight and uncomfortable to enjoy your meal.
The hostess has a very nasty disposition! Very unfriendly and condescending. I live in the area and have never experienced such a rude and nasty service.

Was totally blown away by Saraghina's new place! Not only is the food spectacular (truffle arancini is highly recommended, crab ravioli is out of this world and all three desserts where outrageous but I particularly loved the tiramisu) plus the cocktails are superb as well (heavenly Negroni). The wine list is well curated by their excellent sommelier and all of the staff were very knowledgable as well as warm and friendly, shout out to Jazzy and Rhonda! A true gift to the Ft Greene neighborhood. All of that goodness in a stunning room. Was well worth the wait!

Been a fan of the BedStuy staple for years so was very excited to try this new location/format. We had such a great experience from atmosphere to the food, but especially the service from our waiter Sebastian. He recommended the papardelle which was delicious. Will definitely return making sure to find our favorite server again.
Food was incredible and the service was great. The restaurant itself is beautiful and classy, and located so close to the park. The Fluke Carpaccio is a must try, and the Fumo Negroni was delicious!

I'm going to be honest here and tell you that I'm not really going to talk about the food. It was alright. I'm not a food critic and I'm not going to pretend to be. Was it worth the over $300 it cost? Not really, in my opinion. The steak was overwhelmingly salty, the portions were small and highly priced, the meringue was mostly whipped cream and I actually have no idea what part of it was meringue but I digress. I've had meals I enjoyed more for considerably less, but then again, my taste is not yours, and I am not going to impress it upon you. What I am going to talk about is the fact that Saraghina is one of the most egregious examples of  gentrification I have seen yet. The air is infected with a sort of wealthy self importance that I have never found even in small amounts to be pleasant, and especially not in this case, where it permeates the very tile. I was even rushed out after my exceptionally overpriced meal and told to leave because "there are people waiting for your spot." I am every bit sympathetic to accommodating other people, but the complete lack of tact with which it was brought up was palpable, like a cloying, sickly sweet perfume worn by someone with a demeanor that expresses cleanly and plainly that they think you are not worth their time. There are many beautiful and unique restaurants across New York City that display the vast array of cultures and people that live here. This embarrassingly over-gilded "upper crust" establishment is as far as anything can be from what makes NYC special, and I urge you to support smaller local businesses across the city that both need and actually deserve your patronage.
Just walking through the door made me feel like I was back in Spain! I LOVED this place! Staff was incredible and everything we ate was A+++ if you are in the area - this is a do not miss!

The selection of packaged and deli-case offerings was very appealing. The eat-in fare not so good and best to try authentic food elsewhere. I had a Spanish tortilla and found it a reheated bland mush. The morcilla was cold and insipid. The flan, however, was delicious as was the glass of house wine.  Moreover, the service was spotty and the ordering slow with only one cash register/POS. I'd return to purchase canned seafood and maybe jamón iberico.

This place is a G_dsend. We have a similar place in Miami called Delicias de España, and I sorely missed it when I moved up here. Then, I stumbled onto this place one day while out taking a leisurely stroll in the neighborhood, and I immediately knew I'd found a glowed up version of my go-to. They have so many delicious goods from Spain, like turrones, piñones, delicious cheeses, bocadiilos, pintxos, tortilla de patatas, croquetas, wine and way more deliciousness. I love their tortilla, the codfish croquettes, etc., and everything is reasonably priced.
Best blood sausage in NYC. Definitely a must. Love the shop too, definitely a love letter to Spain in NYC.

We stumbled on this place a few months ago and really liked it, so today we were in the area and looked it up. Great place to stop for some coffee and sandwiches. We had a BLT and the Despana (with ham and goat cheese). You can eat outside but we have eaten in the little cafe area in the back. The staff is very helpful and friendly.

Took a walk after dinner and stumbled on Despana. In search of high quality olive oils, I decided to check out Despana and I am so glad I found this gem! I walked inside having no expectations and I was pleasantly surprised at the selection, quality of products, and service. The kind gentleman explained the different olive oils while I perused their selection. They also had a good variety of cured sausages/meats and pretty much anything needed for a fine charcuterie board or specialities from Spain. I took a chance on purchasing a bottle of olive oil without trying it and the only thing I regret was not purchasing more products. I will definitely be back!

We have been shopping in Despaña for many years and the service and quality is always exceptional. The staff are all friendly and knowledgeable about the products. Come for some lomo,  Jamón Ibérico, chorizo, pulp, or a variety of cheese. Come for one thing leave with a bag full of products. While shopping there it is worth enjoying a few tapas from the back counter which you can get to stay or to go. I wish there were more stores like Despaña around.

Great place for all things Spanish. The reason why I docked a star is that once I ordered serrano ham (not the iberico) and there was a newbie slicing it on the machine. The manager (or owner) threw in a free olive oil torta cracker, which I originally thought was very nice. When I got home, I saw that my 1 lb of ham was horribly sliced! It was all mangled and uneven.

This is a great place to try authentic Goods from Spain. Theresa nice communal table you can sit at, and the head of a real bull hanging on the wall. The tortilla was great, and so was the flan. You get a lot of bread with your order, and there's lots of good olive oil to eat it with.

Decent place if you want speciality items from Spain. I mainly stayed in the grocery portion of Despaña so I cannot comment on the tapas and wine. The space is pretty cramped especially if you visit on the weekend. I was with a couple of folks who are from Spain, and they came out with a bunch of stuff.

Had a tapas here last night. Really substandard fare. Okay asparagus was canned. None of the tapas were fresh are really any good and we had at least 8. The pan con tomate was very average and lacked flavor. Go somewhere else

Very good Spanish food, it compares very well with food you could have in a typical food place in Spain. The prices are reasonable for Manhattan, and considering that almost everything is imported from Spain. If you like cooking Spanish food, you can also buy some ingredients. I would give it 5 stars, but last time I went the croquetas and tortilla seemed a bit chewy, as if they were overheated in the microwave. I will definitely come back though, hoping to upgrade to 5 starts on my next visit!
Love this place super authentic great location and it makes you feel like your back in Spain. They also sell products imported from Spain  spices olives wine etc definitely visit this place in soho

When on lock down or not, Despana offers so many delicious tastes of spain. I probably ordered the wrong Jamon, but it was still good - it's always worth spending a bit more on Jamon. Love the packaged goods, as well. Looking forward to going back to enjoy some spanish beer - they have alhambra. I am not sure that I like the beer but I love having access to it - also, love the bottles. So many great snack foods, too - olives, cheese's - those little hard bread things - what are they called? Also, spanish chips and marcona almonds. I can't wait to go back. Why didn't i order my favorite sandwich - picante?

I experienced the most rude service ever - I get that this job sucks right now cause of Covid - but why taking it on the loyal customers? Cashier gets my order wrong and when I return it she gaslit me and calls me a liar... I order the same single thing every time... why would I lie? Just correct the order that you misheard and move on... and please don't roll your eyes and throw the sandwich at me to show your frustration...what the hell did I do to you guys???! Try yoga?

Best breakfast ever (at home)..made with the blood sausage and scrambled eggs!    However, the tapas I ordered to have while there -- average.  So I only go to buy the sausage or cheese to bring home!

After reading the rave reviews, I was excited to try this place. We stopped in for a quick lunch. The options were a little expensive for a counter service grocery type place. Nevertheless, I got a few items to try. The tortilla Espanola was the best of all of them. The cod spread was good. The blue cheese fritter and cod fritter were okay. My friend said her pork sandwich was just okay too.

Despana, located in Soho, NYC is one of my favorite places to visit when in the area.  Besides offering, authentic Spanish specialties for sale such as Iberico and Pata Negra hams, Spanish chorizos and Salsichones; a hefty variety of Spanish cheeses, and more; it also has a Tapas Café on site!  I absolutely love to taste the different samples they provide before buying or if the time permits sit down in one of their communal tables and relax with a glass of their freshly made Sangria and enjoy any of their delicious tapas or pintxos plates; with the huge amount of choices available on the menu there is always something to please everyone!  If you find extra room or time; their coffee selections and desserts are also a winner!  I particularly like their Crema Catalana! PS: there is also much value for your money here!

It's very hard to find good quality, authentic Spanish delicacies even here in NYC.  After having been to Spain twice, I'm ruined.  However, this shop is an excellent find.  Most if not all items are imported from Spain. This is my 3rd time at this location.   The fresh, hand sliced jamon is awesome....go for the Bellota, it's worth the hefty price! Unfortunately due to CoVid, they are not hand slicing at this time.  The pre-packaged was still good, just not AS good.  Purchase items such as jamon, Marcona almonds, quince paste, some cheeses & croquetas.... you have a meal.

Had the best sandwich ever from Despana, the Pescador, which has tuna, anchovies, and some kind of pepper puree/sauce. Comes toasted and is so delicious. Can't wait to come back as much of the menu as I can. Very friendly service also.

This is one of my favorite little tapas gems. The food is exquisite and I love the friendliness of the staff. I usually do take out at least once a week. Sometimes, even twice a week. Their gazpacho is to die for!!! But every dish is amazing. Give it a try. You'll love it! They even have curbside pickup.

What a cool spot!!! It's a little spot you can buy food to stay and pair with wine next door, or food you can pack on the go or add to a homemade dish. I liked the open, communal seating. I also like how homey it feels. Worth coming here to catch up with friends!

Nice place for food shopping and taking a bite of delicious food.  But service, unfortunately, is lacking to say the least.  One can stand by the counter for a long time without being acknowledged by the staff walking right by.  This has not been one time experience but a consistent pattern.  I would go back, always prepared to walk out with nothing and 15 minutes wasted

This is a special place!  It's a hybrid of tapas restaurants, specialty food mart and wine store that creates a great experience. We usually grab a bottle of wine next door and bring into the restaurant.   They are totally cool with that since they own both. Select tapas from a wide variety at the counter and pay. Have a seat and they bring your selections to you. You can also browse the mart while you wait.  We always bring out of town guest here since it's a great spot to chill and chat. Definitely recommend.
Best sangria in NYC, yes, I said it. Love this place. The food, the wine and the staff. Awesome pave.
Excellent little Spanish shop to check out. I enjoyed an Indi soda pop with a delicious dried tuna and cheese sandwich. You're surrounded by very lovely decor and the various food options are great.

Despana is an absolutely amazing place to buy any Spanish foods.  The best selection of olive oils, cured meats, sundries, etc etc.  The staff are always friendly and VERY informed.  They know their products and can make recommendations when asked.  This is a small place and a little tricky to find, but worth seeking out.  VERY highly recommended.

That Spanish Extra Virgin Olive Oil is gold.  I love it first.  Second is the Pulpo a la Gallega -a small plate of tender sliced octopus on a bed of mashed potato- tasty, but I feel like it needs some kick of spicy. Still, I could easily finish two of those small plates. Third, is the Bocadillo Chorizo- yummily familiar like longaniza sandwich in Filipino eats, except with rice instead of their crunchy artisan bread. I like the Iberico ham bocadillo just as much as the Tortilla Serrano and not much better.  Actually, when I go back here, I'll skip that prized ham and I'll get a glass of wine, instead of horchata. And try some pintxos, perhaps their special offerings, hopefully churros- if they have it this winter- and definitely another pulpo dish!

This place could be great if the food was served at the right temperature and it wasn't overpriced (a small croqueta is $4.30 and is served too hot to eat and enjoy). Great choice of products and concept on the other hand that's why I am saying it could be great.... a word of advice if I may, employ people from your culture that will understand and appreciate how Spanish food should taste and be enjoyed as it is one of the greatest cuisines in the world
Very tasty tapas. Almost felt like I was back in Madrid... almost

Everything we had there was excellent so it's hard to go wrong. It's the best spanish food i've had in NYC. But the stand-out dish was "arroz con jibiones" - squid with squid ink over rice. You gotta get that one. It's not really a restaurant, more like a cafe at the back of a shop. The shop is full of great things too!

The best little Spanish store in NYC.  It has a great meat/cheese deli counter right when you enter.  You can get the most delicious hand carved jamon and an assortment of cheeses.  They also have a wonderful cafe in the back that serves tasty hot/cold foods including croquetas, bocadillos, tortilla espanola and chorizo.  Definitely do not leave here without having a glass of the famous sangria!

Nice place. Expensive but high quality ingredients.  Had the $10 iberico sandwich which was delicious though small. Also the squid and ink on rice which was rich and nice. I'd go back to sample their other fare

After all the hype, I wasn't too impressed. I had the Despana sandwich and the octopus potato tapa. The Despana sandwich was plain and simple and I liked the goat cheese paired with the ham. The octopus potato was so-so and had a weird aftertaste to it. I was a bit disappointed after traveling from Midtown to try the hype :(.

I cannot love this place more! Just been there once so far and I already started to spread my compliments to all my friends in the city. Everything is made from fresh and quality ingredients. I found their squid paella my favourite. Plus, even it's a self-service kind of place. People who helped me order was very nice patient and helpful. I will go there again!

Truly a gem! A friend of mine and I got a $20 bottle from Spain- super original I know. We got the Despaña sandwich which was delicious and one of the most popular in Spain -$10 & change. Will definitely come back and bring my boyfriend. He will love how the place is hidden and chill. Not too busy and a great space full of decorations of Spain and their authentic wines. You can come here for a light dinner and drink to catch up with a good old friend!

The order and pay then sit model it nice for this small grocery/restaurant.The Cava was great. That's all I have for the positives. The food offered was lackluster. Octopus and mashed potatoes dish and the jamon croquet was decent. The main reason for my review is the fideo paella ($25) which is a supposed to be a Valencian style noodle (short stick noodles) with seafood. Instead, I'm pretty sure I was served boxed kraft macaroni. And a very stingy portion of seafood (2 shrimp, 2 mussels). Flavor wise, it need salt and pepper. I wouldn't suggest to have a full meal here, possible a filler in between schedule. After having fideo in Spain and every other Spanish restaraunt in Manhattan done a certain way, this was shocking coming from a supposed authentic and Eataly-esque Spanish grocery store.

Nestled on Broome Street, I discovered an interesting place yesterday. I was quite impressed by the cheese, olives, olive oil, and chorizo selection. This is a good place for a quick bite. I will be coming back again for groceries.

I came here with my friends during a Saturday afternoon. It's a grocery store but there's some seating in the back. It's self-service. I was slightly confused when I first arrived but my friends took the lead. We ordered drinks and a cheese/meat plate. The drinks were good. I really enjoyed the selection of cheese and meat. We lucked out and managed to get seats immediately but I would probably try to come again during downtime instead. It's also not a great place for a large group.

$#@%, how am I supposed to live knowing this place carries an extensive line of Spanish olive oil, vinegar, cured meats, and tapas?! My bank account is screaming 'stop' while my mouth is screaming 'more'. And the most damning element of Despana? Samples. Their never-empty plates of samples. Dammit!

Excellent and friendly service. A great place for a gourmet lunch or if you need a special gift for a foodie. We loved the Despana sandwich and white wine sangria. The croquettes with ham and béchamel were delicious!

After visiting Spain this summer, I was missing the bocadillos, pinchos, and tapas so I searched intensively for a spot in NYC. Despana fills that void for me! It's a one stop shop for cured meats, authentic cheese, and delicious tapas/sandwiches. My favorite is the El Quixote- quince jam is heavenly paired with iberico ham. Bonus casual seating in the back. You bet I'll be back again and again!

I was pleasantly surprised by this place. My coworkers choose to eat here and I wasn't too excited since I'm not usually big on eating pork, and that is in most of the sandwiches, but I tried the chorizo sandwich and it was really good! It's a good option for lunch

DELICIOSO! Food was very good - specially the "croquetas". We took my sisters Spanish boyfriend and let me tell you, that is a pretty tought test to pass. Super cute to have a quick lunch or snack.. We passed by at about 3pm and it worked perfectly for a light snack (bocadillos and croquetas). Really really nice environment too!
Great ambiance and great food. Its a great place to have a glass of wine, appetizer, cheeze, paella, hot chocolate and coffee all in the same sitting. A small place but a must when in NYC.

Please is very inviting and the staff is wonderful and very helpful.  You can try some of the best chorizo and cheese that is important from Spain here.  In the front is the market and they have a kitchen as well. My review is mainly for the sandwhich it was good.  Nothing out of the ordinary and you can really taste the spices in the chorizo which was a bit cold in the middle but charred on the outside. The service is fast and the staff helps with good recommendations.  Grab a glass of wine as well. I am not a fan of wine but I would say it was good.

Definitely my place to go for small bites or meal sized between a proper meal and snack. My favorite is the tortilla egg - very fulfilling. Though price wise I think it's a little high - sad that I can't afford coming here everyday.

The food was super bland, I had the cod crocket, the anchovies and tuna pintoxs and the octopus for apps, for the meal we order a traditional paella which we ended up sending back because the fish wasn't fresh. Super disappointed

I lived in Spain, and this place brings back memories. I have been to plenty of sub-par Spanish restaurants here in the US, but you cannot beat the value for money at Despaña. They have a large menu with quality offerings at good prices. Most people order take-out here, but there is a small dining area, where I enjoyed my bocadillo and tortilla. In addition to being a restaurant, you can buy groceries from Spain and Spanish cookbooks. Next door to the restaurant they have a wine shop with an excellent selection. I will definitely return.

Great atmosphere, and food !If you want to eat like in Spain, come to DeEspaña, the atmosphere is very nice and friendly. And they have a varied range of Spanish products of the best quality. Do not forget to order the mixed plate of cheeses , chorizos and jamon serrano also , the baby eels and the wonderful Spanish tortilla . This place is a real gem in Manhattan. Great prices awesome value !

Wow, this place is a hidden treasure! My coworker recommended this place so I ordered traditional Tortilla Bocadillo ($8.50), a sandwich with potato omelet inside. The portion is huge so I couldn't finish in one setting, and the bread had authentic homemade sourdough taste and texture. It was simply heaven. This place also sells homemade sausages, bread and olive oil and everything looked so delicious in the store/deli. I'll definitely come back when I have enough time for lunch break!

Great spot for lunch if you love Spanish food because the real thing is very hard to find in Manhattan. These guys do it right and they also offer all manner of Spanish products ranging from blood sausage to turrón. I can't say enough about this place I love it.
Great place for a low maintenance night. Food is delicious and service is warm and welcoming. Ensalada de bacalao, boquerones, morcilla, tortilla serrano, and the paella all delicious!

I can't wait to come back here! I love Spanish tapas. We had the meat and cheese board which was pretty great. Their chorizo and manchego was super good. I also ordered the marinated sardines which were to die for!!!! And the red sangria.... oh em geee!! Best sangria ever! I will definitely be back! Next time I want to try the iberico ham.

If your a lover of Spanish food, there is no better place in NYC to find the variety of gourmet items that are sold at Despana, It's both a grocery store and tapas bar. Up front you can find sauces, olives, jamon, chorizo, cheese, cans of all kinds of canned seafood, olives, olive oil, vinegar and more, It's like walking into a shop in Spain. In the back they serve tapas and pinxos, which you can take out or eat in a lovely white-tiled side room. If you're eating in and want wine, just go next door to their wine shop and they'll provide the glasses. Typically, there will be sample of olive oil or olives with pieces of bread on the shelf for you to try. Since almost everything is imported, it can get pricey, but the food is great and authentic. You can get an Iberian foodie experience without having to fly to Madrid.

I will give a 0 star if I can. I came in at 5:40pm(it's even not 5:50pm) on Saturday for slides Serrano hams. And the staff says he is cleaning the machine so the meat counter is closed, but the store hour is to 6:00pm(ya 20 more mins). Probably the time of the staff is really precious, while customers' time is not. I have been here many times and feel really disappointed about this place.

Best Jamon in New York. They really don't need to do more beyond that to be one of my favorite spots in NY. They do have a great selection of treats here though. I kind of wish that their cheese station was a little easier to grab and go, but I can't complain much. This place is great.
Geeeet the Despana sandwich!!! Takes me right back to Spain, it's such a delicious combination of flavors. Great for takeaway or there is a small area to sit there and eat if you'd prefer.

Great time here. We came in at around 12:45. It was amazing! Four of us had the chorizo sandwich and one had some veggies and bread. We all loved it, the spicy is not so spicy so it was great. I can't wait to go back. We sat down at the table, had some flan and we also tried the soup. It was amazing. It's a fun and inviting place I will be back again.
I had really high expectations. Food was alright- expensive for what you get. Drinks outrageously priced even for NYC.

A lovely little Spanish market in Soho that has a floor to ceiling shelf jam-packed with delicious and high-quality sauces, oils, vinegars, canned and jarred fish and veggies, and paellas on one side, a very inviting cured meat and cheese counter on the other side, and in the back, a counter with a variety of different tortillas espagnoles, pinxtos (little skewers with meat or grilled octopus and pickled peppers and other scrumptious bites), and other tapas, and a great wine selection.  There are four long communal tables hidden away to the left of the counter -- very comfortable and spacious.  It's great for a chill meal or a snack while you're waiting for a restaurant nearby, or need a break from walking around the city.  I'll definitely be back.

I stop here before or after my hair appointments across the street to pick up a sandwich and a bottle of wine. I think I've tried every sandwich on the menu and I have yet to be disappointed. So many great meal/snack options here-- they've helped when I've needed to bring something to share to a cocktail party and also have plenty of options for host gifts. Oh, and if you're lucky, free samples! YUM
First time here and the Despaña sandwich was delish! Not a place for date night, but excellent for a quick bite.

I enjoy coming to eat at Despaña. The selection is good, not too expensive considering the food is authentic. The other day when we went to eat there the potato and chorizo dish was pretty greasy. Also, I did not patatas bravas on the menu but noticed another person had ordered it. Maybe clarify the menu options? Also, go easy on the grease!

Combination grocery store and food court style dining. The sandwiches and tortillas were fresh, and there was a great variety. The flan was amazing. The food reminded me of my time in Spain. There is a lot of grocery items to browse through, and you could easily make an authentic Spanish meal with the ingredients.

I saw a Yelp reviews on this place and I knew I had to try it. Oh. My. Gosh. Literally the most amazing chorizo I've ever had! My boyfriend ordered the chorizo sandwich and I ordered the gallego sandwich. Both were to die for! It was a simple combination of my favorite things: MEAT, CHEESE, BREAD, NO BS. Seriously though... I'm considering coming back tomorrow before our trip ends.

It was a bit underwhelming for us given all the raving reviews we read before coming here. The bread and croquetas were the highlights but the patatas and octopus were just okay. We did get the paella but it was far less well done than some of the other places we have tried in the city. Maybe should have heeded to the words of other reviewers and gotten a sandwich. Some of the items felt a bit over priced.

Eating here as I type. Overall, the food was good--at least the one item I expected. Ordered the soup of the day, which was on the chalkboard as creamy leek and carrots. Opened up the container to find a minestrone-like soup with noodles. I brought it up to an employee and all I got was a shrug. They immediately updated the chalkboard. My husband also ordered the morcilla flauta. They brought us the tortilla flauta instead. I also brought this up and she insisted that he ordered the tortilla flauta. Uhm, ok, we know what we ordered. They were not apologetic about the soup nor about taking our order incorrectly. Docked stars for lack of customer service. Not sure if we'll ever be back.

The food is authentic and delicious , not a fancy spot to eat in more casual .. but for me it's about the food and I felt it was as close as possible to eating in Spain .. I have an affinity for spots when I can eat and shop at the same time .

Loved the food and atmosphere here! I had a girls night out with my friends and we wanted a place where we could spend catching up over good food and drinks. We ordered tapas: fried potatoes served with aioli sauce, octopus, chorizo. We also had their squid ink paella and sparkling sangria. Everything was delicious! We also loved the place because the dining area is relaxed (not formal with wait staff checking in feeling rushed to turn tables on a busy Saturday night)! It is also located in SoHo where we could easily grab after dinner drinks/go dancing nearby.
Great place to grab a bite to eat and a glass of Prosecco.  Tapas is wonderful and grab some to take home

The tapas here is the best tapas I have had outside of Spain. I love the format - you just point and pick and then they bring it to your table. The fish tapas were the highlights - wonderful, fresh, and not greasy.

I've come to Despana three times now but i'll be honest - so far i've only come here for the Fuet. Can you blame me though? Despana is the only place i've found Fuet in CA and NYC. If you're wondering what it is, it's a delicious pork sausage flavored with powdered milk that melts in your mouth. I was brought some from Spain, and while it found it tasted better, the one at Despana is great. I even took some back home as a gift for family. The staff here really know what theyr'e about, though. I've asked them if they have anything comparable to fuet and ive received consistent answers, so I know they're not lying. I'll be back for sure and maybe this time i'll try something else!

One of the places that makes me happy to be a New Yorker. The food here is DELICIOUS and authentic and affordable. Love that in addition of the prepared foods you can also sample many of their imported items prior to purchasing them.  Small, clean area in the back where you can enjoy your meal after ordering at the cash register.

This was my second time here. We ordered two tortillas and they were delicious. You can never go wrong with tortillas española. I also liked that they had small plates with pieces of chocolate on each table for free.
Food could use some help, but the fact that you can go next door to their wine store and bring it over to eat with your meal is worthy of repeat visits!

I been here 4x I think it's about to give a review in this place. Every time I come here always great experience in everything. The food is always taste good,  very friendly workers and friendly costumer. I highly recommend this place if you want some small plate and a bottle of wine or some beer, catching up with friends or family or anything. Just come down and let me know your experience.
Wow this place is awesome. We ordered two sandwiches that were both great but I loved the picante sandwich. It had a perfect spicy taste.

This review is long overdue; I've been going here a few times a week for the past two years. It's the right combination of good quality, friendly staff and reasonable prices. I haven't had anything I didn't like, but I keep going back for the Serrano salad and BLT bocadillo in particular. Bonus: if you have to wait, there are always tasty samples of cheese, meat and canned goods to keep you occupied. Pro tip: they have a punch card! It's not well advertised, so be sure to ask.
The place is small but offers a great variety of food from Spain. Lots of wine and beer choices from the continent. A nice place for lunch .
Wow, what a gem. Take a day off from work, come here (head to the back of the store) for an awesome tapas spread and sangria with your loved one, and savor life! Trust me!

Omg this place is amazing!! The squid cooked in squid ink was absolute divine!! Wow, I'd come back just for this. I wish we could've tried the squid ink paella but it serves 3. All tapas are so amazing!!! You have to try it!

I wasn't sure about this place , thinking about Spanish food I  though it will not be the same, but I'm totally impressed I got a tostada de pulpo and bocadillo Despaña and my boyfriend got a croquetas Ibéricas, i just can say OMG these were so delicious , excelent Spanish cuisine

Ordered seafood paella, anchovy tapa, and octopus tapa. Anchovy for $7 was not bad. The octopus was good but mashed potato underneath was okay. Seafood paella takes about 30 minutes to be served. It tastes okay not the best paella I've had. Came here after reading the reviews about how great the food is but my experience was disappointing.
I just wanted to add an update and say, the morcilla bocadillo is a religious experience, and the verdinas con jamon are a little plate of comfort.

We were driving by the street and decided to park nearby before walking over to Soho. Of course we couldnt resist checking out the brightly lit store/bistro. It's store front in the front and places to sit down and eat in the back. They carried an array of good Spanish/Portuguese products. We picked up some canned sea urchin products! Looked amazing cant wait to try them.

This was a really neat discovery!  It seemed really authentic and the food was delicious and the people who worked there were helpful and friendly.  I'm not Spanish so I can't really judge but I was really happy with what I ordered.

This is a great little Spanish store in Soho. Around lunchtime they usually have out samples of various types of chorizo, cheese, marcona almonds, olive oils, etc. The staff is friendly and helpful, and their sandwiches are great! I haven't tried their Spanish tortillas yet, but they sell a few different varieties and they all look great.
Perfect place situated in soho for a shopping break... warning once the break takes place Despañas tapa and sangria may suck you in and future shopping will no longer take place.

AmaZing Spanish tapas nested in West Village. I loved the small and warm feeling of the restaurant. The food is just divine and if you love tapas, you should try this place. The only recommendation I'd make is to come up with a side dish of just Spanish churizzo sausages, that would be awesome!
I've only eaten one thing here - the Vegetariano sandwich, no olives. I dream about this sandwich. Every bite is delicious. Every time. Also, they sell chupa chups. Easy five stars.

I have been wanting to come to this place for a long time I  purchased their packaged goods from Spain but never ate at the small restaurant in the back, I had rose wine and an assortment of tapas- incredible!! Plus  highend olive oil and vinegar on the table for everyone to use. Very nice servers ;)
Hands down the most delicious spanish tapas in nyc. Some of our favorites include the manchego chorizo sandwich, ham croquetas, tortilla and red sangria.

We ordered meat, cheese, olives, and asparagus platters for our wedding. Delivery was on time, and the food was delicious! My wife's family is Spanish and they were impressed which says a lot! Despaña also makes some serious chorizo sandwiches in store. Yum!

This place has been a long time favorite of a close friend of mine. I took advantage of jury duty and checked this out for lunch. I had the bocadillo tortilla española as recommended by my friend. It was huge! And delish! I ate half and took the rest home. The pintxos looked great and the deli and specialty food section looked amazing too! I wanted to check out the wine store next door as well. I'll definitely be adding this place to my stock of go-to places for Spanish items.

When walking by, you don't even realize you could eat there but the seating is hidden in the back around the corner. The seating area is small and it seems like locals hang out here for awhile and the tourist pass through more quickly. It's nice to grab a glass of wine and order some of the tapas. After 3pm there's a mixed plate you can get with a couple different of the open sandwich items or the the tapas items they have for the day. It's a nice way to try out different items for a good price. The rest of the store has some grocery items like olive oil, vinegar, cheeses, and meats. This would be a great place to buy items for a picnic when the weather is nice.
A great find for lunch. We tried several small plates and a Despaña sandwich. The shared table concept In the back took you to Europe. Plenty of tasty options for everyone.

To All of DESPANA in New York, Thank you, Thank you, Very Much for delivering my order so quickly. Please allow me to explain. On Thursday, April 09, 2020 I placed an order and paid for the next day delivery. Because the the order was placed after 12:30 pm. The order was not scheduled to arrive until Monday, April 13,2020. On April 10, 2020 at approximately 1200 pm I spoke with a with a lady at the Woodhaven, N.Y. location. I explained my situation. she mentioned she would see what she can do. The order arrived at the delivery location shortly after. The products from DESPANA are part of a gift for my wife who has been working hard during these incredible difficult times at her hospital as a nurse. The products will be used during a live cooking class I have setup with a chef from Spain online. We shall be making various kinds of TAPAS. Thank you again. She will be pleased. I will be purchasing from DESPANA again. Incredible service.
Probably the most delicious Spanish tapas resto/bar I know of till date! Incredible jamón !!!
Had an amazing dinner with potatoes, Spanish olives, something like bruschetta, and Jamon Iberico. Absolutely want to come back and try everything else, especially the sandwiches.

Love this place.  I had goat cheese on toasted pan with caramelized onions, jamon iberico, gazpacho and blood sausage. Everything I have tried is pretty amazing. The jamon is extremely pricey but worth it. Service is polite if a bit quiet because of the language barrier (they all speak spanish). The new sommelier wine consultant is a wizard. She picked out an amazing bottle of red based on our preferences. Full body, not too tannic, fruit but dry. She gave us the background on the wine...It came from grape vines that were over 200 years old and untouched by phylloxera so they were gnarly and beautiful. It was amazing. And, I love sitting in the back surrounded by cool marble. A quiet little oasis amidst the bustle. The wines are $10+. But even the inexpensive ones are special.

One of my favorite places in ny! The food reminds me of when I was living abroad in Madrid. The space is nice, service is great and you have flexibility in ordering whatever you want whenever you want. They always have delicious food samples too!

Really cool place. I loved their picante bocadillo! Their gazpacho and tortilla were great too! Not the biggest fan of their chorizo a la sidra, but I would definitely go back. Such a cool joint; it even smelled like Spain.
Great Tapas place. Their patatas bravas are as close as I could get, to the ones I long for, from Spain.

This place is heaven!!!! Went to NYC on vacation and had to stop at Despaña twice. My favorite was the tortilla bocadillo. I also did a little bit of shopping  there and everything I got was soooooo gooood!!! I only wish I had bought more stuff because I can't take a trip all the way from California for some chorizo and other goodies...or can I?

You can easily misinterpret this place as a regular grocery store. As I was on a quest to find some sandwiches I kept walking back and saw that there was seating in the back as well. I've only tried the prosciutto and goat cheese sandwich but will definitely be back soon to try more of the menu.

Great place offering authentic Spanish tapas. You can go next door to the wine store and pick a special bottle out to enjoy with your food. Be sure and try the iberico croquettes...they are delicious!
This place will serve you an expensive glass of wine in an immaculate glass and then give you your pincho de tortilla with a plastic fork. Por qué??? So unpleasant (and environmentally whack).

Small place, decent offerings of Spanish goodies. I had a couple of croquettes and a spanish omelet at the cafe in the back. They have plenty of fresh cheese and meats to choose from as well and a nice selection of olive oils and other spanish tapas items. if you are craving authenticity, this suffices. Not as overpriced as Little Spain.

So damn good! The sandwiches were delicious and the wine was even more delicious. Great atmosphere. Loved all the samples on our way in. Cute little hidden table area near the back. Enjoyed being able to pick out and purchase a bottle of wine next door and then sit down and eat and enjoy the food as well the as bottle of wine.

I love this low key and feel-authentic place. Best value for the food and wine from Spain. And I love their wine glasses (tells me about how much they pay attention to details to be authentic:) . Perfect for hangout w a few good friends for casual talk and fine wine and tapas. Only complaint: they close too early on week days.
This is such a great mid day stop. Prefect bite plate tapas. Good wine. Pleasant music.
Love this place the food is outstanding I will definitely recommend plus great service

Speedy service. Nice decor and atmosphere. Communal tables. Authentic tapas that are comparable with what can be had in Spain. Wine shop next door. Try the croquettes and boquerones.  Manchego cheese was delicious as well.  Gazpacho was forgettable. But to be fair I've only had gazpacho at one other restaurant, Bocadillo in Seville, and they've been open since 1654 or so.  That being said, you may find the gazpacho enjoyable.

I really liked this place. It's a block or two removed from the downtown crowds, and has great sandwiches and wine, as well as and a clean, informal cafe space in the back of the store. Aside from a place to enjoy a nice lunch, there is the counter at the front which has a good selection of Spanish cheeses and meats (also canned goods) to take home. Staff was friendly and helpful, too.
This is authentic Spanish food with that European touch other restaurants fail to duplicate. Best Spanish food in NYC!
What a lovely hidden gem. Grocery in front of the store, prepared food in the back, and seating available in friendly setting. Excellent selection golf wine and beverages. Samples were plenty.

This is my first time at a Spanish grocer. Can't say that I know what authentic Spanish food tastes like but I definitely know what a good sandwich tastes like! I had the Picante and it was delicious. The bread was so crispy, just the way I like it! After ordering, there's seatings on the side where we settled and enjoyed our food. There's complimentary olive oil on the table; I dropped some on the sandwich bread for taste and it was so good. Prices are very reasonable for soho area ($8.50 for a sandwich), definitely plan on being back here some other time.

The food was definitely authentic and sooooooo good but the customer service wasn't the best.  Everyone there is really nice but I felt once they saw a group of college kids walk in they thought we wouldn't buy anything so they kinda ignored us even though we were eager to learn about spaniard food and culture. We ordered a cheese and meat platter that cost $25 but it was enough food to fill two people and the drinks there are really cool. Everything is imported and set for sampling which really let's you experience the differences in quality and taste among brands and flavors. It's a nice place to go alone or with a friend but no large groups.
Very nice causal lunch place food was delicious will definitely go back took some items to go as well.

I stopped in for a quick snack.  It's always nice to find a place that serves pintxos (so rare outside of Barcelona).  I enjoyed my pintxos boquerones (cured anchovies with tomato) and am looking forward to coming back to try some more items.

Legit and relatively authentic place. Think eataly on a much smaller scale, but for all things Spain. My wife is Spanish and we are here almost every other week. Unpretentious environment with high quality food. Do it.
This is the place for authentic Spanish cuisine. Not only does the place look authentic but they deliver on the food. There are some items that are a little pricey but you get what you pay for.

I frickin love tapas! Awesome fare, an adventurous heart (ok, it's not like you are eating hakari, (Icelandic rotten shark) or something. It is a well rounded sojourn through Spain. Wine selections are available through their sister store, next-door. We had gespacho, so smooth that I wanted to cry, pinxto (four tort with Carmelites onions and goat cheese and a hot pepper and andouille sausage sandwich that would make my cardiologist consider future investment opportunities! All in a casual setting, worth the walk!

This is a Spanish specialty store. They serve hand carved Jamon Iberico for a reasonable price. They also packaged Jamon and other Spanish products for sale. I had just come back from a long vacation in Spain and missed the Jamon Iberico so much. Thanks to this store I was able to relive my dream vacation a bit. They also serve Spanish wine and there's a wine store dedicated to Spanish wine next door.

The selection of meats and cheeses were great, the ambience was great, and the food being served was, again, great! Not much more to say than that, but it's definitely worth stopping by and having a look/try.

This is my go-to spot and my secret, well not so anymore! Let's just say that I absolutely love love love and miss food from Spain. Since my trip I have never come across any restaurant or shop not even close. Go here for the jamon - yes it is a must have! Also try their pinxtos, and they have a wide variety. I like how it is also a store and you can get all the goodies without a trip to Spain! This is the closest to authentic food from Spain!

I am sorry to say that the online ordering of products was awful. Of what I have read, dining in seems quite different. We ordered some products online and the products we received were stale and tasted gross. Hope Others have a better experience.
Super cute and cosy sandwich/tapas place! We were shopping in soho and fancied a casual yet tasty lunch, so glad we found this place! Great sandwiches and friendly service.

Great tapas and flan but delivery can be slow.  I highly recommend the serrano and creme croquette and the flan, although most of the dishes here are vey tasty.  Be sure to grab a serving of the machego and some marcona almonds to take home with you.  It's the best snack ever when you have the pair with some chilled grapes.
Awesome place and friendly service. Been here twice for lunch now and have gotten the gallego with aioli. Can't go wrong.
If you want a taste of Spain, come here to get your fix. Authentic.

Great little place off the beaten path for drinks and tapas. Lots of choice just as in a tapas bar in Barcelona. The ambiance is also what you'd expect in a Spanish bar with blasting music, plenty of Spanish speaking folks. Would go back without a hesitation

I trekked 35 minutes there because of the rave reviews. Disappointing! The bread in the chorizo was dry with flaky skin, a sure sign of stale bread re-heated. The jambon and cheese were high sodium, which were to be expected for Spanish ham and cheese. But the ham had absolutely not the distinct flavor or aroma like the Serrano or other ham I had in Spain and D.C. The cheese cake, small by US standard, was OK and the blueberries were fresh enough. (Then a baker has to be really inept to screw up a cheesecake right?) The vino tinto (Mibal) at $12 was the best part, smooth and aromatic. The whole bill came to $28.41 not including tip, expensive when one considers the food taste and quantity, and that it is a walk-up-to-order eatery attached to their store.

There's a special place in my stomach for this place. Truly takes me back to Spain with all my favorite bocadillos & tapas. If you have time, it's nice to sit inside and relax a bit as if you were having a leisurely lunch on the Mediterranean. If not, take out is just as delicious.

Authentic Spanish groceries, meats, cheeses with small tapas and bocadillos cafe.  Wonderful canned seafoods and Spanish spices. You can sample the vinegars and oils. The tapas y pintxos are authentic and pretty reasonably priced. Close to Little Italy and Chinatown. They also have bottled water, soft drinks and wine. A nice place for a quick snack.

Having just come back from Spain, I was already going through Spanish food withdrawl. Can one actually be addicted to Vichy Catalan? It seems so. I've been told smuggling in Iberico ham is a big deal so I ate it all on the plane knowing I wouldn't not be around its ubiquity in a while. Some razor clams, angula, and fideua rounded out the goods that I picked up before heading back home. Wish the had a San Francisco branch! I think the price was the only shocker but then I was in Spain with a depressed economy and the best euro to dollar conversion in a long time. Regardless, it's a great little store, it's just too far from me. 4.5 stars

Very cosy place and the food had a lot of flavour. They didn't have a few of the specialties today but made up for it with tasting platter on the house. Dessert and coffee is on the house too. They really look after you here at Despana's.

This is a very good place.  I had the chick pea with chorizo soup which was very nice and not expensive at all.  The house bread is also very good.  They have an awesome variety of cheeses and hams and the prices are not outrageous.  Very cool place, definitely recommend!
This place is very casual. Great atmosphere, even better food! Highly recommend trying the Spanish tortillas.

Saved myself a plane ticket lookin for some quality jamon iberico. Their gazpacho is on point. Also, they have quite a selection of beers from Spain. Kinda wish I lived next door right about now. Anyways, if you miss Spanish food (from Spain), this is where you wanna be.

Another tip for those of you who are traveling to NYC. Go to Despaña, order some cheese, jamon serrano, and anything else that might suit your fancy and just leave it in your day bag. If it's convenient, go a couple blocks to Balthazar's Bakery and get a loaf of french bread, if not, don't worry. Now find a park, bench, or go to the pop up park on Mulberry. Snack away and enjoy the city!
Terrific shop and yummy sandwiches and salad. Very affordable. I frequent this place for lunch.

Customer service is fantastic. I bought 25 dollars of packaged Jamon and realized I could get twice As much for the same price of freshly sliced. Even though I had already paid, they took back what I ordered and gave me 30 dollars worth of fresh product without charging me any extra. Will be back
The cheeses they have here are amazing. They range from strong to mild and have a large section of choices. The workers are all friendly and helpful and let you sample a lot before you purchase.

I love this shop.  It fills up the hole in my heart that Spain left when I had to move back to the States.  The food is completely fabulous, but I do take away a star for the price.  Pinchos (aka pintxos) are almost 2-3X more expensive than what I was used to paying in Madrid, but it can't be helped.  We're not in Spain anymore.  Churros con chocolate could use some work, too, but since it is cheaper to travel to Despana than it is to travel to Espana, I'll get my fix at Despana - just not too often.

Great place to stop in for a casual but authentic lunch/HH/dinner - whatever type of meal you're looking for.  Great tapas, great wine.  Fun, fresh ambiance.  Feels very authentic and made me miss Spain!
We went there for dinner and it was not as great as we had imagined. Don't order the paella- it is flavourful but with stingy amount of meat and seafood...

My husband lived in Spain for a couple of years so when we were in NYC, he wanted to check this place out. We tried the Tortilla Deserrano (Spanish omelette w/ potatoes and serrano ham), the Chorizo Bocadillo (chorizo, manchego cheese and olive oil) and the Chocolate con churros...mmmmm!!! Everything was fantastic!! We can't wait to return next time we're in NYC!!
Large coffee, small coffee and flan cost me $8. Very reasonable and we enjoyed sampling chorizo. I visit one in queens, and this soho one has cafe inside.

Excellent. Great food. Nice casual vibe. Friendly and helpful staff. Cheese, olive oil and tapenade tastings. Amazing olive oil at every table. And we bought an awesome bottle of wine (Planella 2011) next door to have with our food. Do it!
I would give them 15 stars if I could. The only place for miles and miles to get fresh sliced Iberian ham. Also they have a wonderful little Spanish market selection, plus many amazing olive oils.

The Picante sandwich is hands down one of the best sandwiches in NYC. It's thin, hot, simple and so delicious. The store and restaurant are also great. I've tried all the sandwiches. I work around the block. The Picante is the one. All hail the Picante.

A Spanish store of FOOOOOD?! So much fun! So many fun samples everywhere. Their cheeses were amazing and you can't go wrong with picking that up with some charcuterie for a party. Heck if you come back from Spain and forget a souvenir, you can swing by place;)
Nice find. Cozy back seating area but great choices of tortillas, hams, tapas, olives, cheese and wine. We had gazpacho, egg and potato sandwich and a glass of Cava.

Nice comfort food.  Cheese platter covers basic bases (sheep, goat, cow; majón, manchego), with superfluous bleu.  Chorizo of a salami-like variety.  Pleasant, satisfying tortillas with no flare or twist, just solid craftsmanship (served cold, as is often the custom).  One red wine available by the bottle - decent and forgettable from the first sip.  This is the authentic-mac-and-cheese analog of Spanish cuisine.

This was my go to spot for a great cheese board and rose sangria. Despaña is known for great speedy service, however yesterday we waited 50 mins for our board. The server told the guy making the boards that we've been waiting 30 mins and he continued to service everyone else which delayed the order longer. At that point my pitcher of sangria was watered down. Train the new staff because Elaine and Juan and the other old staff were on point.
Love, Love, Love this place. Great for a quick bite or to do some light shopping for chorizo and olive oil.
Went in for lunch on a Thursday and my oh my. Service was amazing, sandwich amazing and $10.  Will definitely come by to try that sangria  & get some jam

Finally had my squid/seafood paella, just OK rating - they were skimpy on the seafood, and with the experience, it's one star only.  Despana needs to get organized with the logistics - a diner has to save a seat and get on line to pick up the paella that's on the paper plate. The $15 price would be sweeter if it included the beer/wine. I've experienced it now and don't need to come back. It's just better to go to a real Spanish restaurant and have seating and table service.
Great Spanish food, I tried bocadillo Jamon serano with goat cheese, it was so good, the girl that took my order was so helpful and patient. awesome spot to visit.

I've never been to Spain, but the food looked and tasted authentic. Haha! Though the menu was a bit difficult to choose from (so many choices and descriptions), the window display of your menu options made it a lot easier. Portions are pretty small, but that's what you get for reasonably priced tapas in the area. And all of the items that are on sale in the restaurant are from Spain.

Meh.  The place reminds me of Eataly, only a mini version and Spanish.  Bought their stick of salami and it did't really wow me.  Prices are high, but I suppose if you want a taste of Spain (though a lot of their product seems to be made in the USA), come check it out.

We love love loved Despana. Both the grocery store and the deli/restaurant. While the prices may be a little expensive (for the grocery portion), the deli was fairly priced. All of the meats and cheeses were delicious and we loved the salad we got as well. Unfortunately I have no idea what we ate, besides the tortilla (very good), croqueta, some type of chorizo/cheese stack, and a salad. That being said, it was all delicious and felt fresh and authentic. I would definitely come back if we are in the neighborhood again!

Why has it taken me forever to come here?! Popped in on a rainy afternoon and the store was empty, score!! Great shop with a wide variety of products ranging from ham, cheese, sausages, and lots of prepared food. I went in knowing exactly what I wanted and ordered a 1/4 pound of serrano ham, 4 pieces of tortilla Espanola, and one other tapas that was cod on bread. Also picked up some cans of tuna, which is amazing and puts American tuna to shame. Everything was delicious. One thing to note, it seems like they don't take orders for the tortilla in the late afternoon. I wanted to take an entire one home but the guy said it was too late, so I had to take individual pieces. That is the only bummer. Will def be back.

Friendly helpful staff. Amazing imported cheese and dry meat selection as well as many rare goods straight from Spain! Head to the back for an amazing selection of tapas many featuring chorizo. I stumbled upon this place by accident but it was meant to be :)

Quality went way, way, way down since I had gone. Prices have gone up and sandwiches are now getting into an overpriced range. The portion size has gotten smaller and smaller. The flavor of the meats and cheese seems to have gradually declined as well.

Lots of Meats and Cheeses. Love this place. The Despana Sandwich is excellent. Great place to grab a quick lunch or for take away. The plus plus is that they have free tasting of all kinds of chorizo meat. Yum yum yum
Come here for a quick lunch - their sandwiches with serrano or chorizo are pretty good and you can also get some ham/sausage to make bread at home.

The place to be that have a brunch on Saturday ! There are actually Spanish dishes and products !! Th place is really clean with those large tables made in white marble, everybody can sit around. It's a "mid-pub, mid-market" place with a quiet setting. Only a little something could be enhanced : churros con chocolate .. not so great but everything else is delightful !

Delicious. Everyone was welcoming. The way they spoke about the food and drinks made our quiet lunch a touch more exciting. I just had my wisdom teeth pulled, but every painful bite made me happy. Apple soda BLT and flan... So good
Anything you miss about Spain is here, only cleaner and closer. Feel free to hang in the spotless dining area and enjoy a long lazy afternoon.

Simply! the Best place to eat!  Also sells homemade sausages, bread and olive oil and everything looked so delicious in the store/deli. I'll definitely come back when I have enough time for lunch break!
Love the blood sausage, jamon and wide selection of Spanish delicacies! Everything is delicious!!!

If I cooked, I'm sure I would come here for ingredients. Since I don't cook, I merely ogled at the wide variety of Spanish imports and helped myself to the samples along the shelfs. If you're hungry, there is prepared food in the back along with some tables. And if you need a housewarming gift for a foodie friend, you're bound to find something here.

I tried the vegetariano sandwich. In it was the normal type of vegetables. The difference with this sandwich was the bread. I liked the bread and the fact that it was thin, but the outer layer of the bread was a bit too floury; I had to wipe my mouth after every bite!
This place is very nice and comfortable. Had the Chorizo sandwich, it was delicious! And the Jamon Iberico is really good! Going to come back!

Great place for a quick Spanish bite.  The sandwiches are amazing- the Gallego and the Picante are my absolute favorites.  The serrano ham croquettes are also pretty good.  I also love that you can buy authentic Spanish ingredients while you're there for your own home cooking.  They even have Turron de Alicante, which I've never see in NY.  Will definitely be going back again and again.

I had the best service one morning here , I was looking for a cheese like a  pecorino he knew what I needed and had me taste some other great things  . This guy knows cheese ! As I was leaving he unlocked the door  , They weren't even open yet    And they helped me  not get out were not open yet !  I wish I knew his name he was a class act ! I think it was john  .The prices were great too not the normal soho rip off   I cannot say enough good about this place!!!!!

went for a quick bite,ordered 3 croquetas(serrano ham,iberico ham and cabrales),Tortilla and a glass of wine.Price was 30$,a bit expensive,especially when croquetas felt soggy ,like they were microwaved.Had much better elsewhere(try Nai in east village),tortilla was ok. Thank goodness for the wine,made me temporarily forget about the disappointing food.
First time to Despana.  Great food, great prices.  Nice little find in Soho without the pretension.
Like being in Madrid. This place is amazing
Best Spanish coffee hands down my favorite place to go, and it's always a chilled vibe and the tables are rarely filled.  go read a book there, and eat some awesome tapas.

AWESOME casual spot for montaditos (little sandwiches) while you take a break from shopping. Great selection of small delicacies if you're looking to buy something (for a gift basket maybe?), but I always come for the quick bites at the bar. Staff is always helpful and the meats and cheeses are top notch. Really love this little gem.
Forget the mac & cheese try their pallela in a box that's great and so easy anyone can make it and it's delicious

Amazing food in the back, and one of the only places (only?) That sells bellota. The tapas in the back are high quality meals and suitable for both eat in and take out. The wine shop next door will take care of you for pairing too

Normally I stay clear of tourists magnets and this place certainly is but - the tapas and sandwiches are amazing.  If you like Serano ham you will become a regular in no time. Friendly staff and clean environment - only problem is that it's tiny and it gets busy.

We were here for the paella event.  Great food, service and people.  We like to have a bite here then shop at the store and around the neighborhood before heading to a park to take a nap.  That's our Sunday ritual.  A+

This is a great authentic Spanish market and bistro. Our party of four ordered four different sandwiches and a couple of salads. They were all excellent. I especially liked the picante panini that had jamon Serrano and sausages. It was little spicy and very delicious. Inside, you feel transported to Barcelona with Catalan and Basque specialties. I love this place.

Excellent prepared food if a bit pricey for the pinchos et al. Great cheese and good prices. Wonderful selection of spanish specialties at good to premium prices. Very friendly staff. Wine store has excellent selection and I haven't gone wrong. ¡Si!

Ummmmm. Tapas on a plastic plate and with plastic folks. This is so not the Spanish tapas experience I was expecting. First of all, it was over priced for what you are getting. I give them one star because sangria was actually decent, but it was served in a plastic cup. I really had high expectations about this place by reading all the reviews on Yelp, but this experience was not good at all. I would recommend going somewhere else for Spanish tapas. There are plenty of good tapas places in the city, but not THIS PLACE!

I love any grocery that doubles as a lunch spot.  I came in here once for flan--awesome--and came back for a casual dinner.  They have great products, ranging from cured meats, to various olive oils, olives, Spanish treats, and various packaged mysterious seafoods.  The sandwiches are amazing; I had the Despana and my boyfriend tried the veggie one--the bread is so tasty and everything is really fresh and flavorful.  The coffee is excellent too!  I'll definitely be back for more cured meat goodness :)

More of a great Spanish tapas "deli" than a traditional tapas bar. However, for a moment, I thought I was back in Spain! Very fresh foods and quite authentic. Pleasant service. Sometimes tables and seats are hard to come by. It is that good! Recommended.

No frills Spanish spot with high quality cold cuts and cheese. I love the fact that you can buy wine from the wine shop next door (which is also owned by the same restaurant) and enjoy it inside without paying corkage fees or even restaurant mark up. Good for moderately sized group outing which was how I was introduced to this place. This is a solid alternative to Sunday brunch with 6-7 friends.
Had lunch there w/girlfriend yesterday. Good location in SoHo. Really tasty. All of croquetas dishes are great. Also thumbs up to the tosta cebolla. Good service too.

Forget the overpriced inauthentic rubbish one finds nowadays in SoHo and NoLita. Come here instead for the real deal: the best cheeses, almonds, olive oils, olives, cured meats in NYC. My gf is Basque and we love nothing better than spending some time here  tasting, then sitting in the back drinking a couple of beers with friends enjoying their Pinxtos, especially the cured pork loin, boquerones, and awe inspiring morcillo.

This was my first time at Despaña. We had a wonderful time. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. This very nice guy at the register explained everything to us and helped us to select our food. We started with croquetas de jamon that were really good. Then we had a Spanish tortilla and a sandwich with chorizo made by  Despaña - divine. The seafood paella was our last dish of the evening. It was good too. I am planning on going back soon and trying a few other options. One more thing, we had the wine they suggested and it was excelente! I would recommend Despaña to my friends.

Great spot, friendly staff, and amazing tapas/salads/and food! When you enter this store/cafe and walk your way toward the counter in the back you magically seem to work up an appetite. Everything just looks so yummy.  The Spanish tapas here are great and the price is definitely reasonable. The tuna salad with pepper spread, anchovies and anchovy dressing is amazing and I'm not even that big a fan of tuna. The octopus toast is amazing, pepper stuffed with cod pinxto is a winner , and the sausage cheese and pepper pinxto is always delicious. You really can't go wrong here with any o the tapas. Last but not least make sure to order a glass or two of Sangria it is absolutely amazing!

Our best find this year. A low key lovely dining room to wile away the hours nibbling at delicacies of Iberia. With Spanish beers in the cooler and a whole wine store next door, you can complement your croquetas with uncommon cervezas and vinos.
Yum yum yum ! Def worth a pit stop in between that shopping . Food is great , coffee is amazing!

46 reviews so far but I'll throw my two cents in too. A word to the wise: Don't come here hungry. If you love good Spanish food, tapas the the like you'll be seventh heaven at this smartly stocked market cum cafe serving the best of the Iberian peninsula. I stumbled upon it and once inside knew I had struck a gold mine of good things to nosh on. I'm not the only smart savvy New Yorker who knows good food in this food-obsessed city of ours [sorry San Francisco, this is the real deal]. Prices skew high but not stratospheric and there's something for everyone to like. Often they have some cheeses and meats on sample and if that won't get you to open your wallet, something else will. I personally could camp out here and eat until they closed - it's that good.
This place is awesome. We had the Picante and the Chorizo sandwiches and loved them both. The gazpacho is also amazing. We will be coming back.

Excellent little place. The tortilla original was light and airy even with the potatoes that were sliced thin. The choriezo in cider was not nearly as spicy as the Mexican version and was also nicely cooked with minimal fat to the meaty sausage. There is a very nice wine shop next door that has just Spanish wines and were well selected as well.

My friend and I have both been to Spain and wanted to have authentic tapas again. Everything we ordered at Despaña was delicious! Pintxos Majoma and Brandada were two of my favorites. While I might have experienced having tapas in Spain, I was able to appreciate the simplicity of the food, the textures, and the flavors more today (with a nice glass of sangria)!
I love coming here to pick up hand cut data negra.  Whenever I have time I like browsing here and then enjoying some tapas and wine.

I don't even know where to begin. Despana's sandwiches consistently bring me to my knees. My friend and I have a system where we'll each order different ones and trade halves, and in my experience you can't go wrong. I think my favorites would have to be the Picante, the Despana, the Gallego, and the Navarrico. I love this place I love my friend I'm glad we have our Spanish sandwich focused ritual.

I must admit, they have one of the amazing selections of assorted Spanish meats and cheeses I've ever seen. Sadly, some of their sandwiches doesn't live up to the ingredients, it almost feels as if they failed to meet their potential. I'd say purchase their products and make your own sandwiches at home!

Solid food & setting. The tapas match the fare served in Spain. We had the cheese plate, chorizo picante, bread with tomatoes, and the gazpacho. All the dishes were well made and reasonably priced for tapas(America has a confusing concept where tapas are extravagantly priced, whereas it isn't the case in Spain at all, and looks like Despana is trying to mimic to an extent the pricing in Spain) Oh, and to top it all, the Sangria was fantastic!
WARNING: those seeking churros con chocolate will not find it here (menu needs to be updated). Having said that, the torta was p good and so was the jamón serrano.
I was so excited when I found this place. Not only is there great prepared food and desserts, but there's also a grocery section where I can find all my favorite things and take them home.
