The sitting area is somewhat cafeteria like and off putting, the snacks are not bad

A Spanish charcuteria on the edge of Little Italy, Despana is a refreshing new addition to the neighborhood.  With bountiful free samples of oils, vinegars, spreads, and other tasties, the lunchtime wait for a bocadillo (sandwich) breezes by.  The bocadillos aren't cheap ($7+) for their relatively small size, but the ingredient quality is immediately apparent on your first bite into a crispy, warm Sullivan St Bakery ciabatta.  The meat & cheese counter looks very appealing, with a wide variety, and although I haven't tried it yet, I can hear the chorizo calling my name...
5 stars are not enough. This place is like a bite of Spain right here in NYC. Anything you order I guarantee you will love. Cant wait to go back.

This place is one of my favorite lunch spots..although seating can be very tight.  There's always olive oil and balsamic vinegar that you can sample.  Sometimes they even have chorizo and dried meats samples!  The sandwiches are delicious.  I highly recommend the picante (chorizo, mahon cheese & peppers served warm) and the despana (serrano ham & goat cheese).  I layoff the tomatoes in both.  The bread for the despana is a bit hard and my jaw gets tired but I still love it.  I heard the tapas are really good too but haven't a chance to try yet.
If you work or live nearby the sandwiches are an amazing secret. Really really brilliant. 7 bucks is a bargain, considering what they put on there.

New York needs more places like this. Well-executed, limited selection, reasonably priced high-quality food products. Prices are really reasonable particularly considering this is Soho. Good selection of little plates to eat in the small space in the back as well.

GREAT place to buy Spanish meats, cheese, dips, oils and sauces - they provide lots of free tastings of their sausages, deli meats, and cheese and are always extremely friendly and knowledgeable. Their "bocadillo" sandwiches are also delicious - toasty and crispy on the outside with great fillings on the inside - a tasty lunch option for when you're in the Soho area!

I came across Despana when I heard rumors of it carrying an aloe vera/rhubarb white chocolate that I was curious to try (Very good but sadly, I bought the last bar before they discontinued stocking it).  But I was very impressed by the inventory of this place.  Whenever I want to utilize my lunch hour for a nice stroll, I always swing by Despana because there is always some free tastings to be had and I'm a big fan of that!  From the sounds of things, I should try some of their sandwiches.
Service was good. Seated quickly. The food was a little bland but cooked well. I would go back to try again,
My favourite place to buy Spanish food (esp. Jamon Iberico de Bellota) and wine. Absolutely love this place.

My trip to Despana was a cultural experience. I never had Spanish food before. Spanish meaning food from Spain. It was quite different from the Puerto Rican or Colombian dishes that I was use to. As I walked through the door my mouth started to water. The smell was enticing. My vision was filled with fancy bottles of jams, cheeses, and oils. I want it all !! Quickly I began to search for the tables and a menu. I finally found the tables all the way in the back, along with the menu. First thought was, so many choices to choose from. What do i choose? Tortilla & idiazabal and chorizo in apple cider was the first things that I ordered. It was sort of a potato cheese with cured ham mini sandwich. It was quite a treat especially the chorizo . This made me quickly go back to the counter to order more things. Next up was Quijote. If there's anything to try this is it. Dry cured pork loin (lomo) with Manchego cheese and quince spread. Wow!! The flavor of the pork, cheese and quince blended so well together. It was such a delight that I had to take small bites so that I could savior the taste. Check the pictures it ll make your mouth water too!!

I love Spanish food and after our recent trip to Barcelona, my wife and I have been dying to find good authentic pintxos in New York.  Though not quite up to par with our tapas/pintxos crawl around El Born, this place satisfied our fix.  We tried LOTS of their pintxos and they were all quite good.  I would specifically recommend anything with ham or chorizo.  The goat cheese and carmelized onions pintxo was also quite good.  If you're really hungry it can get expensive but it's a great stop for a small bite.  We will most definitely return.  They also sell Estrella Galicia beer, which is great on a hot day.

I love tapas! I was so excited to try yhis restaurant, it gets great reviews and is close to work for me.  I was shocked with the price of the food, lunch cost me $18!  The best item I had was the bacalao, which was amazing. I don't think I will return just based on the price alone. Good but not great.
Friendly staff. Delicious selection of meats and cheeses. Sandwiches on the heavy side, yet surprisingly satisfying.
Made a large order for a gift to our planner. The produce they have is just excellent and I was very happy with their flexibility and professionalism managing my shipping requirements.

A great place for Spanish tapas.  A small place but great service.  Even though you order at the counter they bring the food to you.  They place is very clean.  There's also a great selection of wine at the wine store.  The food taste great and authentic.

Looking for top notch european delights and unique ingredients that you remember eating when you were in europe and JUST CANT SEEM TO FIND IN THE US?  well come to despana and you'll find all those wonderful little additions to the food that you are looking for...spicy anchoives, baby cuttlefish, chopped clams, ventresca tuna, canned (in glass) flat beans, cheeses, fresh jamon (up to 168$ per pound mind you).  Talk about a wonderful place to come to get a picnic in the park together.  The staff is SOOOOO friendly, and they are totally on Spanish time...you'll see what that means when you come!

I'm sure i'm a little biased since I fell in love with Barcelona last year and had just gotten off a cross-continental flight, but this is the one thing I keep talking about from my last trip to NYC.  I don't even remember the details on the sandwich I bought, I just remember that it was dense & delicious, the deuce.  Grabbed that and a Sprite and was set for hours of walking around.  Oh how I long to return there.  And I shall - someday.  If you're near it, go by.  It's worth it.  I'm jealous of anyone that works in the area, since they get to enjoy this godsend on a regular basis.

Wow, what a find. Someone once described this place to me as a much smaller Spanish version of Eataly...I would tend to agree.  Ordered tapas from the counter and it's nearly impossible to choose among a menu filled with chorizo and manchego featured treats. Meats and cheese are my passion so this meal was perfection. Conveniently located right next store is a wine shop with wonderful selection and super helpful staff. We brought our selection back next door to enjoy with plenty of tapas and tortilla. The eating area is on the smaller side but we were able to sit and enjoy from noon to one on a Saturday. There is no formal table service but the woman at the counter kindly brought our food over and uncorked our wine. Chorizo and chestnuts were the highlight of the menu but everything was mouth-watering!

Good stuff. Very hearty meal. Love picante sand which. What like the most is their meal pairing options. Your provided with fine foods you can't really find anywhere else. Very courteous with your meal order. This is now a new fav spot.

Great lunch, great prices, wonderful area to sit in and enjoy said lunch. Had a meeting here today. The staff was highly personable and brings you all your food after you order. The blood sausage I had was incredibly delicious and nutritious. Don't be afraid to try it- it does not taste overly "meaty' or like iron. I also had a Serrano Ham salad and it was bursting with flavor, meat, cheese and greens. Very good value & will be back!

Some friends and i stumbled across this wonderful place on a walk home from Chinatown.... We had some Cortados, bought some olive oil and soem Kas for our vodka limons.. next time im out there i will try the bocadillos and update my review!
This store is very pleasant. The staff is friendly, and helped me to pick out a great spanish cheese to pair with my dinner. and the serrano ham was delicious.

Finally stopped into Despaña for a sandwich. Staff was friendly, service was fast, and the ingredients were fresh. I'll definitely be going back and trying more items on the menu. Great lunch spot if you're out and about in soho.
Truly amazing! feels & taste like your back in Spain..
Great, authentic Spanish foods and very delicious sandwiches. Love stopping in here for a sandwich with my husband, who is Spanish and also gives this place the thumbs up.
Awesome food.  I don't know how else to say it.  Give this place a shot for sure.

It is around the place I stayed and I swung in to check it out as Yelp says it's good. I ordered a sandwich the store is famous for and it tastes good. (lots of cheese with different texture and tastes.) Judging from other customers' order and tapa, I think they are good. Will try next time in New York downtown.

Wow I'm in the middle of eating the Catalan sandwich and its so good I had to make sure I Yelped this place before I forget. The staff was very friendly and helpful and its actually decently priced for what you get. The bread is a great mix of chewy/crunchy and the ingredients are very flavorful. I'll have to start coming in here more often for my lunchbreak.

Oh my goodness, these sandwiches were just delicious.  I really miss living in NY (I live across the country now) where you can get quality ingredients like this.  I had the Despana sandwich, with serrano ham & creamy goat cheese and my eating partner had a hot sandwich with thinly sliced manchego and serrano ham (I think).  The bread was perfectly sort of hard on the outside and chewy and amazing.  The sandwiches were pretty sizeable, too.  It was so good.  I want food like this in San Diego.  Now I'm just sad.

Friendly staff. Loved the horchata drink she recommended. Very sweet but very refreshing. I tried one of their small tapas with cod. It was nice and simple. They also offered their dark chocolate with nuts. It was delicious! Not bitter and very delicious. Wanted to buy some but they ran out. Definitely coming back.
La verdad in comida española. I hope this place is here forever. Great selection of canned foods from Spain.

Picante bocadilla: finally real REALLY REAL chorizo.... none of this freaky hot pink casing bobagem! Not only chorizo, but chorizo picante, with some mahon and fresh tomatoes... I died and was reborn a Spaniard.

Great selection, but I thought the prices were shockingly high, even for that part of town. The service was pretty poor as well; the older woman who I took to be the manager got testy when I asked a couple of basic questions, as though I were wasting her time. I regret spending my hard earned money there, quite frankly.

Caught the fever for manchego & chorizo in Spain last week and stumbled on Despana this week. The samples are plentiful, the flavors are great. The best part? It's completely reasonable! A half pound of the stinkiest Spanish take on blue cheese is $9.00. Hard to beat that even at the grocery store.

Came here for ingredients for a tapas party (my first serious attempt to cook Spanish) and although the place is small, I was impressed with the presentation and diverse selection of items.  Atmosphere was warm and welcoming.  The staff were a great help in explaining and making recommendations for various items I wanted to buy (e.g., cheese, olives, pimientos), and I was able to try some of the items before choosing.  Prices seem reasonable considering everything seems to be imported from Spain, although I admit I don't have a point of comparison.  Tapas party was a success so I'll definitely be back for the next party.  Will be trying their prepared foods next time too.

Manchego, Idiazabal, Chorizo, Iberico de Bellota, Serrano, Olive Oil, Pimenton de la vera. I feel like this is Mary Poppings and I am singing "These are a few of my favourite things". Fantastic selection and if you have never tried these Spanish delicacies you need to get here now.

I was married to a Spaniard so this is were we would go to get all of our products to have an authentic picnic or meal.  Sea Urchin Pate, stuffed peppers, chorizo cantinpalo, queso manchego,jamon serrano,  white asparagus....yum, yum and yum.  The bocadillos are delicious.  The staff is always helpful and you can get ur fill from all the samples.   Personally, I like the one in Jackson Heights better, their service is much more personable.
Awesome spot to get chorizo! They have loads of interesting spreads etc so if youre in the area, pay them a visit :)

This place was a lot of fun - great selection of Spanish import items (some with FREE samples!!), great selection of cheeses/chorizo/cured meats, and delicious tapas in the case near the back.  The downsides were the tapas were very expensive and seating was limited.  It was a nice getaway from the craziness of SoHo for a bit though and I would stop by again for a treat.

I am officially in love. Thsi place is so cozy,clean and unique in its own ways. Very attentive staff, positive vibe, delicious dishes, relaxing ambiance-a little heaven in a middle of stormy soho. samples of diffirent items are just another sweet detail that hooked me up as soon as i walked into the place.

I had a hankering for morcilla (blood sausage), and Despaña filled that void in my day. You walk in alongside a refrigerated deli counter with lots of cheese and sausage items that you can purchase to bring home. In the back, there's another serving area where you order pre-prepared tapas. I did find it a bit annoying that they didn't serve alcohol. The man behind the counter told me that you had to buy an entire bottle of wine in their other storefront next door, and they would open it for you. I only wanted one glass, so I didn't bother. I ordered a cup of coffee instead. They said they had to brew it, and I had to wait about 10 minutes, which was longer than I expected though. I want to come back to try some of their other tapas the next time I'm in the neighborhood.
Delicious snacks. The butcher table converted into a dining table is a nice touch.

Only tried one thing (Tortilla & Gambas) but wasn't overly impressed.  The displays have all sorts of tapas to choose from, but my eyes led me wrong.  I'd try some of the other things people have recommended.

What a wonderful little shop Despaña is. The counter and seating area at the back are nice, and they make cute little tapas, pintxos, and flautas that make for a satisying lunch. But I've become a regular for their produce. Their selection of canned and jarred seafood is incomparable in the city - high-quality brands like Cabo de Peñas that are above and beyond what you'll find elsewhere, and at very reasonable prices for said quality. Their counter o' pork, as well, has some real treats: the morcilla (blood sausage) and lomo embuchado (cured pork loin) are among the best I've had in NYC, and they slice their Iberico by hand - which, while expensive, is still cheaper than at many other establishments. Great place to grab a quick bite or put together a meal for later at home. One of NYC's newest treasures, there's no other store quite like them.
We had the Despana sandwich...great sandwich but the goat cheese (although very good) was a little over powering....overall very satisfied...would def come back
Such delicious treats. Lots of samples and very helpful staff. Very reasonable prices for the amazing quality.
Delicious coffee and espresso!  It's getting harder to find.  Thank you.

Love the charm, the food, the selection.  I keep thinking about the Pescador bocadillo (sandwich) I had.  Soft bonito (white meat tuna) and large anchovies with a creamy red piquillo pepper spread on a crusty ciabatta.  Yum...I've really got to haul my ass back down there and pick up some of that spread to take home.  And, of course, try their other delicious offerings.  Somewhat pricey.  Pescador was $8.50.

Amazing. Everything I have ever tasted out of this place has been incredible. Sardines, ham (yes I splurged on the Iberico), cheese, olives, oh my. And well worth every penny. Just finished the Pescado sandwich. Omg. I want ten more.
My pintxos got mixed up but what I ended up having was still muy delicioso!

I never had anything mediocre here. Everything here is delicious, made properly and is such high quality. I absolutely love that I can pop in here for a snack anytime. Their gazpacho is summer is like other-worldly-seriously awesome.

Great food, good prices.  Looks like a grocery from the street -- there is a small seating area inside in the back -- we were afraid it would fill up, but we were there through the lunch hour on a Monday & it never got crowded.  Everything we had was delicious.  Nice alternative between either full restaurant service or fast food or take-out.

I've only been here once but it was memorable. I liked the space a lot; grocery on one side and a place in the back to dine-in. I had a plain cheese sandwich but it was delicious. Also, bought a bottle of olive oil. Would definitely return.

Fantastic coffee, fantastic tapas, I lucked out having this across from my office. The eponymous Despana sandwich is a staple of my weekly diet, and I love a good tortilla for breakfast once in a while. Very friendly service, too. I can't imagine how much more I'd love this spot if I was in the market for the Spanish delicacies, but it's so nice to taste a cured meat or a cheese on my way back to the coffee counter.
Excellent quality. Authentic. And I like the idea of tasting the food that they make, and if you like it, they sell all the ingredients you need to make it. Awesome lunch spot too.

I absolutely love this place! The food is amazing and I love that they import all their ingredients from Spain. They sell the ingredients in the grocery store and use them to make sandwiches . . . you get to sample olive oil while you wait for your sandwich! Everyone who works here is very friendly, too. And the prices are reasonable, $8 for a big chorizo sandwich is a great price! (but their soup is expensive, fair warning!)
Good foods. Nice selection in the deli and store. Bunch of cool specialty food items. My mom would love this place.
Tasty treats abound! I'd come here a lot if I were fancier.
Love this place since I found it it's great they have a variety of things that make u think ur In Spain enjoying all the delicious food and drink...

This is a nice little spot tucked away -- I don't think we'd have come across it if not for Yelp. We had a couple of very good little sandwiches and some bites of grilled octopus. Everything was good, and the small attached grocery had a lot of appealing looking items. The prices seemed surprisingly reasonable as well.
The food here is amazing! Everything from the sandwiches to the olives were so perfectly delectable. Definitely worth the trip downtown!
Very nice selection of imported food. Came in for their tapas and it was delicious. The most memorable item from here is their butternut squash soup
The Picante bocadillo at Despana in SOHO was yummy: chorizo picante, mahon cheese, Basque guindilla peppers, tomatoes, and olive oil. Ole!!

Great place to buy Spanish products and eat some Spanish food like tortilla, pintxos, bocadillos. Their "marron glace" is amazing and they even have polvorones close to Christmas time! They don't have an extensive list of options in regards to some products (such as olive oil), but the ones they sell are hand picked.

Was so good , had to go for seconds. This place is more like a Delly with seating. 3 big common tables on the side. I had small sandwiches that are on display just because i could point and say " this one" . All of them were fantastic! I also had Chorizos con castanas. Very very good. Spicy chorizo and  sweet chestnuts, so good! Next time i am in that part of town i will make a point of going there again.

This place is so amazing. They have just about everything I could ever want to purchase for cooking up spanish foods. Chorizo, Jamón, Pulpo, olive oil, etc...They also have a great selection of small lunch plates to eat which are also amazing. definitely worth going to!
Came here on a whim before shopping. Typically I don't like cured meats, but this place made prosciutto and chorizo sandwiches perfectly.
The despana sandwich is one of the best things ever. When I'm in the city, its a non-negotiable.

Amazing selection of cheeses and meats!  Good place to stop for a small snack (pintxo's) and tasting some great spreads, olive oils, etc.  Spiced & Fried Almonds are a great host gift or snack to put out at a party.
Excellent food! Great and friendly service! Wanna try a little bit of everything? Is place had at least ten tasting stations.  I had one of the best sandwiches I've had in NYC.  Soooo good!

I love this place.  My go to store for fantastic cheeses and meats and sandwiches.  Best sandwiches in NYC in my opinion.  There is a decent selection of high quality cheeses and chorizo and other Spanish specialties.  Highly recommended.
Great place. Grab a bottle of wine from the wine section and enjoy it with excellent tapas.

Hands down the best Spanish sandwich IN NYC! Brings me back to the days when I studied abroad in Spain. We highly recommend going here to get a bocadillo and a glass of their amazing red Sangria. Unassuming Spanish market, with seats in the back and a favorite of ours!

I wish I could say that my last experience was better than my first few experiences here but I cannot.  I have been coming here to procure items that my wife (she is from Spain) enjoys.  However, the service is terrible.  We wanted to have a sandwich but having experienced the abysmal portion sizes and inferior quality of meats and condiments used in the sandwich on previous occasions, we thought this time we would buy the meats and things we wanted separately and make our own sandwhich.  I told this to the main manager and he said we could not eat the sandwich which was completely bought (meat and breads) from their store neither there nor could we eat it outside the store. A hispanic woman comes over and starts complaining in spanish that if we are thinking of eating that sandwich in the store we cannot and on and on for 5 minutes until my wife interrupted the constant back and forth since she understands Spanish and said we had already said we are not eating the sandwich in the store I think I am allowed to buy the meats separately to make a sandwich right?! then she was like playing dumb and said "Oh I don't know I don't  know I don't speak english" and left.  then the guy started complaining that he could not find his carving knife and made a big stink of complaining of having to slice the meat for us.  After having bought the bread and all the stuffings which again was really not much more in terms of portion size for 40 dollars we asked if he could use the knife to slice the bread in half and he said he could not do that.  We asked if we could use a knife he said no, we asked if his kitchen staff could cut it in half he said they are too busy.  There was another couple standing next to us and one couple already eating and he is saying the kitchen staff is too busy to slice a piece of bread in half so we could eat it in the park.  The items or overpriced the quality of the products has gone down and the service is horrible.  If more people in spain have that kind of attitude toward service then it is no wonder Spain's economy is in the state it is.  You are not doing anyone favors and you are not the only place for people to get products from Spain.  Your attitude and service is pathetic and an insult to what Spanish hospitality should be.

Hands down my favorite (Spanish) sandwich shop in the city.  It is a little piece of Spain in NYC.  Everything there is great, from the sandwiches to the gazpacho.  The last time I went in they encouraged me to BYOB, or even split a bottle of wine with my date, after apologizing they had no wine to sell.  Favorite sandwiches are the Catalan and the Gallego and they even have a small deli for you to try and buy their jamon.  Highly suggest everything there.

¡Sabroso! Remember your trips to Spain with free samples of chorizo, jamón Serrano and other Spanish delicacies. In the back you can buy a bocadillo, a small bite-sized sandwich. If you can afford it, try the jamón ibérico. It's delicious.
Whenever I'm in the area I can't resist coming here for lunch. The best jamon sandwiches and soups.
Incredible, most typical Spanish food you can find in NYC (I'm from Spain). Really good quality. Worth completely the money.

Great service, great food and free samples. The jamón ibérico is the best, but it's very expensive. The jamón Serrano is less expensive, and it's also delicious. Almost everything is delicious. Give it a try.
It takes me back to my childhood when we would go to Casa  Moneo to buy  products from Spain for Chrismas Eve. At Despana I find the wonderful treats and warm staff.

Tapas lovers and Iberian food aficionados swear by this stylish outpost of Despaña Brand Foods, a Queens-based importer of Spanish provisions well known to savvy New York chefs. Neatly stacked shelves stocked with canned olives, paella rice and mixes, bottled and tinned squid, and jarred piquillo peppers greet shoppers at the entrance; inside, customers encounter clusters of olive oils, vinegars, honey, and preserves, even sugared chestnuts and whole preserved pears. The region's noted seafood--cured fish, marinated anchovies, smoked tuna, and salt cod--is complemented by a solid selection of Spanish cheeses, from aged and young manchego to a creamy-soft tetilla and a leaf-wrapped blue cheese. A meat counter offers plentiful tidbits for tasting, like morcilla (blood sausage) and imported ham sliced paper thin, which are laid out on every surface to tempt novices to expand their culinary experiences. If the samples whet your appetite for more, you can order toothsome takeaway bocadillos, made-to-order sandwiches served on ciabatta from Grand Daisy Bakery
Great tapas and sandwiches! Ideal for a quick bite. Downside is that it can be crowded but that's fine when eating solo - go make some new friends!

A bit pricey but everything is amazing and well worth it. Got two sandwiches and two glasses of wine just superb. Wine selection from Spain is the best around for rare and good bottles, haven't gotten a bad recommendation yet, they know their stuff.

Yummy, yummy sandwiches!  Perfectly toasted, delicious bread, and great Spanish meats and cheeses.  It was so hard for me to decide which one I wanted!  I also love how there are samples everywhere - I tried so many different types of chorizos and cheeses (inluding La Serena!) and love that they encourage you to taste things, because they know you'll get hooked.  The only down side was that the pintxos we tried were ice cold, making it a little unpleasant to eat.  I will be back soon to stock up on Spanish ingredients, before stopping by at the wine store next door.

Yes you should come here. It's a great place if you want good food but aren't in the mood for a big production. The quality is excellent and authentic. We shared the picante sandwich and the Despana.  Great chorizo made on premises and the ham and cheese was def genuine Spanish. We also ordered the octopus over mash potatoes tapas swimming in olive oil. Really tender and tasty and I'm not a big fan of octopus. This was just good.

having moved from spain a few months ago to New York, Im happy to say that deespana is one of my favorite spots in the city. Not only is their food amazing, the staff are friendly and they even have products from more less known places such as the canary islands where Im from. Get the mojo picon (red) for some boiled potatoes. Thanks deespana for making me feel at home!

Despana is such a cute grocery market. I discovered it one day last Spring when I was running errands in SoHo. I decided to give it a try and ordered some jamon and manchego cheese. It was delicious! The food products are definitely authentic! I then went back with my family to create a Spanish-inspired happy hour before we went out to dinner. We had jamon, chorizo, manchago, olives, and crackers with a Spanish wine we had bought somewhere else. It was quite expensive, but we ended up with plenty of left overs. This place isn't cheap, but it sure is a treat. Go when you're feeling the urge for some quality Spanish foods or you're hosting a party - your guests will be so thankful, but your wallet probably won't be!

This is one of the best places for tapas in NYC.  It is a casual sit down place but that doesn't take away from the delicious tapas they serve!  The prices are lower than a typical tapas restaurants and you can bring your own wine and there are no corkage feeds. Will be my go to spot for delectable tapas!

Great Place, love the "bocadillos", and i heard they will expand, and now they have delivery....am i lucky or what???? If you love Spain and live in NYC, this place is a MUST!!!! By the way, join the Despana Ny group in Facebook....!!!!
Tasty and reasonably priced tapas in a casual setting. My friend and I had a tasty lunch for $25, which isn't easy to accomplish. I would particularly recommend the pulpo pinxto.
I thoroughly enjoyed lunch at this cafe.  Nice to get away from the soho crowds. Delicious manchego salads and tortilla Espanola at a reasonable price.  Highly recommend Despana!
one of my favorite places to go buy random food items i've never tried -- and different versions of things i am more familiar with.

Great Tapas spot and excellent spanish wine selection at the wine store next door.  Pick your best wine next door and bring it in to enjoy your tapas....lets just say I had to take a few trips back inside the wine store.

I got a sandwich here for lunch this week.  I really liked it.  The sandwich wasn't overstuffed, but also wasn't tiny- it was just right for lunch.  The ingredients tasted like they were very fresh and high-quality.  I had the Despana sandwich, and the goat cheese on it was absolutely amazing!  The service was REALLY quick.  I'll definitely go back!

hellooooo! i love despanaaaaaa! had a few things, and all were perfectly delicious. i just wanted one of everything. so ultra serious. i don't believe there's one yucky thing on that menu. this has easily become one of my favorite nyc spots. do yourself a favor, and go yesterday

The place to be that have a brunch on Saturday ! There are really Spanish dishes and products !! Th place is very clean with those big tables made in white marble, everybody can sit around. It is a "mid-bar, mid-grocery" place with a quiet atmosphere. Just a little something could be improved : churros con chocolate .. not so good but everything else is delicious !

Authentic Spanish ham, cheese, olives, almonds, and other delicacies. Authentic and no too too pricey (but a little bit). Right now this is my in town go to for arbequinas, marconas, and jamon serrano.
I went there last year while visiting NYC; I am still thinking about them and planning on visiting again this year when I go to New York. That should tell you something!

great lunch place- working in soho this is a great place to escape the hustle while making you feel like your on fiesta in Spain for a hour. yummy salads that's a good portion and delish tapas! And you get to try the samples! :)

This place is freaking awesome.  A specialty market with free samples of delicious meats and cheeses when you first enter.  And then a few communal tables in the back.  Just grab a menu and order at the counter and they will bring the food out to you.  Authentic Spanish eats.  Even the bottled water is 'Fuensanta'.   I had the Serrano croquette, chestnuts flauta, and zucchini tortilla and everything was delicious.  Friendly service as well.  This place was a find and I would definitely revisit.
Tasty.  Wonderful gourmet to go.  Try a plate of black sausage and tomato sauce or chorizo and potatoes...though there are innumerable fine selections to be had.  A "go-to" for iberico ham.
This place is amazing. Love their food to stay and the take out produce such as cold cuts and olives are always in my apartment. Highly recommend them.
I tried the Despana Bocadillo and it was amazing. I thought I was done until I saw some pata negra.Needless to say I had to get some of that too! I can't wait to go back.
Fanstastic food.  Flat out.  The sandwiches are so damn good.  not far from the SOHO shopping.  Stop in and grab a bite.  You will not be sorry.

This place is a gem... You will feel transported to Spain. Buy a bocadillo and take it to the park for a lovely picnic (the ciabatta travels well) or enjoy it at home paired with a nice glass of wine. The sandwich size is large enough to share, especially because the ingredients are pretty rich. I find that for the price, the salads seem a bit expensive (also, based on experience, they seems to either be out of or missing some of the ingredients listed). However, I sometimes still feel compelled to order a salad because their homemade dressing is so lip-smacking good!
This place misses the mark on the Chorizo Bocadillo. Bread is thick and there is not much chorizo or cheese. Let down. Especially for 8.50.
All the sandwiches are so tasty and the staff is super friendly! If you love chorizo you have to try one of their sandwiches with chorizo in it...delicious!

Why is this so good? I am gaining weight from the delicious olive oils, chorizo and tinned seafood. If you get hungry while you are shopping,  you can have snacks in a gorgeous marble sitting area. I love this place!

I try to come by here once a week for lunch to treat myself to a delicious sandwich. I have had at least 4-5 different bocadillos and can say all are really, really tasty! El Quijote may be one of my favorites because of the sweet/salty combination from the pork and quince spread. Highly reccomend!
Outstanding jamón serrano bocadillo - this has to be one of the best sandwiches in Nolita. I was a first timer at Despaña today, but I'll be going back for a taste of Spain frequently from now on.

OK I've been here a couple of times already. I make the drive from Long Island  pay the toll to the Bronx. The food has been over the top each time. The staff is very friendly and the service is top noch.

my gf and i couldn't decide what we were in the mood for, so we opened yelp and i swiped and randomly choose despana. just imagine that "n" has a squiggly line on top of it.. i dont' know how to write a  squiggly n on my computer. anyway, what a great choice! i was pretty confused when i walked in, because it didnt' look like a restaurant, but then we found the cafeteria style seating in the back. i glanced at the menu and saw the very reasonable prices, and quickly decided that the unconventional seating is the way to go. after consulting with my venezuelan girlfriend about what a chorizo was, we both ordered sandwiches. while waiting for them, the lady at the register told us we could go next door and buy a bottle of wine to enjoy with our meal. score! we ran next door and found that the rose wine was 20% off for valentines day. perfect. anyway, we spent a good hour and a half in there laughing and eating and drinking. such a great lunch. we'll probably be back if we're around the area!

I found out about Despana last week via the internet because I was looking for a local place to buy pata negra for my husband who comes from the South of Spain.  We got up early this Sunday morning and headed on out to Soho to see for ourselves all the authentic Spanish cuisine.  My first impression was not of awe as I was disappointed in that an establishment that sells authentic Spanish cuisine would have behind the counter women who were not from Spain (they are Mexican) not the same thing.  The owner I was told is from Columbia, another let down.  The majority of the staff excluding the manager who is from Mallorca, Spain are from Mexico.    As for the bocadillos, yes the chorizo tortilla was heavenly and the cod croquet as well.  But I went in the hopes of finding authentic churros, and what I got was a Mexican lady opening up a plastic bag of so called churros and placing them in a microwave then sprinkeling sugar.  I walked out with a big let down.  If you have to go authentic with the products, at least have a Native Spanish person put up the business and hire family members from Spain, not Mexico.
Amazing team! Amazing foods! Amazing ambience! Me and my partner had a great time. Thanks for everything!

Decent Brooklyn spot for a casual brunch! I came here with friends on a Sunday morning and unfortunately, there wasn't any a/c since it's a converted train car. Cool concept, but don't expect a spacious or luxurious experience. The service is really friendly and helpful! We all got the egg sandwich, which comes with a good sized side salad. My friends raved about this sandwich so I had high expectations, but I guess there's not a whole lot of flavor to pack a punch in such a sandwich. The bread was very good, but I would probably try something else here if I came again.
The waiters were quite rude, though they wore ridiculous outfits, which I appreciated. Pricey for the quality and serving size, though tasty. Beers were overpriced and at a small selection.
Loved the atmosphere inside. Super unique. The food was good but plain for how much we were paying.

Not quite the ambience and decor I would choose if I owned a restaurant, but I suppose some Williamsburg hipsters really like it. I was a bit sad to see that many of the items people have referred to here on yelp weren't on their brunch menu anymore. I wish they had more gluten-free options. The shakshuka I ordered tasted just like canned tomato paste I have at home, but with an 800% price markup. The aioli potatoes were good, but not enough to save the meal. Definitely not worth the price.
Best food and staff! Great natural wine selection as well. Ask for Anna as your server as she's the best! Great drinks and a great atmosphere. Will be back!

Really nice wholesome spot for a satisfying brunch. I've been here a couple of times and have always experienced excellent service. You cannot go wrong with the burger, perfectly cooked and very juicy. The fries are good too and the serving size is perfect for a hearty meal. They also have excellent salads and other sides. Definitely recommend for the warm vibes and fantastic food!

My roommate went out of town and I was feeling a little lonely, so I took myself to dinner! Diner was perfect for that. Not too crowded, soft lighting, great place to have a glass of wine and read my book. Menu apparently changes a lot, but the pork chop was a delight. I truly love a spot where dinner alone feels just right

There is not much to say in this small, albeit intimate diner. Aesthetically, you might find it to be rambunctious and scrappy- reminiscent of an inn from Reno, NV with that Brooklyn twist, respectively. You'll find the tastiest $20 Caesar that is well-dressed in anchovy goodness. I would give five stars, but they served my partner burnt bread and had to ask for it to be removed- great recovery with a supplement of bread on the side, but unfortunately is what I remember from the experience. Friendly staff and the energy of the place is far from dull.

Stopped here for a quick bite, saw a customer having the cesar salad and had to try it. It was hugeeee. The sauce backed a punch but it was delicious..I was only able to eat half. I jad it with two servings of crusty bread. I devoured the rest later in the night. The set us is cute. Alot of outdoor seating. Perfect for covid dining and the warmer weather. Inside is pretty small but outside was were it was at.
Small menu. Excellent food. Very cool establishment. Impressive cocktail menu. Absolutely unique. Worth every dollar spent. Best pork chop that I've had in my life.

We had a really great brunch here. We got the burger, the fried chicken sandwich, and the French toast. Of the three, the chicken sandwich was my favorite, and my wife's was the burger, but we really enjoyed all three.
Lovely spot.   Caesar salad is overdressed.  Tasting it all night long.  It was a drunken salad if you can imagine the leaves swimming in tang.

We stayed next door and came here for breakfast.  Aside from the great ambiance and music, the food and coffee was really tasty. I had the huevos rancheros and my husband had the pancakes. Huevos tasted authentic with just the right amount of spice and over easy eggs.  The pancakes had a great flavor.  Bacon was a little too thick for us. The coffee was delicious and the service was good (way better than the worst reviews led me to fear!).  Recommend - especially for anyone staying at Soho Grand for a convenient and yummy breakfast.
Still one of the best burgers in Brooklyn. Good service, great food that is thoughtfully sourced, and a nice location.

Have been a loyal patron here for over 10 years, like 2-3 times in a week sometimes. The staff is awful. I put up with it as long as I could because of location, ambiance and the cocktails are great. No more. The hostess, many different ones are the rudest of them all. This has been happening pre-COVID and worse after. Worst part is I don't think anyone here cares. They've lost there great clientele and now it's basic b's with basic B staff and basic ass food that used to be good and now is under or over cooked and tasteless. Save your coin and over pay where your at least treated with dignity

First time here was 20 years ago and never realized the significance this establishment would have in the farm-to-table movement. Always fresh and organic ingredients with great daily specials. Staples in the menu include a juicy burger, well seasoned chicken dish, mussels, and hanger steak plate. Recently had lunch and the food was still banging!! Can't wait to return.

I used to love this place but the last two times i was there... the food felt lackluster and the service wasnt great. They didn't realize that we were ready to order and ready to pay. But the burger used to be so good!
So adorable, delicious and service. Wonderful experience and highly recommend. Try the burger.
One of my more regrettable meals in a while.  Food & service were bland & basic.  3 stars for the strong alcoholic drinks & pleasant relaxing outdoor seating area.

We always have such a great time here and the food is consistently amazing. Tonight, we came for dinner and started with fritters to share - the perfect appetizer for 4 (or even for 2!). We had the skate, burger, and mussels - all were so flavorful and satisfying. This will always be a place I bring friends from out of town and is a neighborhood favorite - great atmosphere, great food - we love Diner!
Stellar service, unique and delicious beverages, and perfectly seasoned, fresh takes on classic dishes like a breakfast sandwich. Highly recommend. excited to try everything on the menu!

We went on a Sunday morning.  Overall, I would say that this is a very good place to go have brunch.  The food is fresh and delicious.  The hostess sat us quickly.  The server was attentive.  The food came fast.  We ordered the caesar salad, the hash with eggs and the egg sandwich.  We also got an ordered of toast.  First, the plates were huge which is wonderful.  The caesar salad was delicious with a dressing that tasted homemade.  The croutons were crunchy, nicely seasoned and also tasted and looked like they were homemade.  The egg sandwich came with a butter brioche bun and a huge salad.  The havarti cheese on the egg made it delicious along with the aioli that came with it.  The eggs on the hash were perfectly runny on to the hash. The hash had potatoes and tasted like it had a chipotle seasoning which gave it a little bit of heat.  The toast was a sourdough bread with butter.  It was definitely fresh.  I would definitely recommend.  Very good!

The service here was absolutely terrible. Our server was extremely rude and unwelcoming. She took over 15 min to come to our table and did not introduce herself or anything and said "do you want to order?" We had ordered with another waiter because she took so long to come and when we told her we had already ordered, she just left without apologizing. That was the only time she came to our table. When we were leaving, she did not say thank you or anything and walked right past us. It's safe to say I will not be coming here again. The food was ok, but not worth dealing with the terrible service.

Even though saying this might mean that the entire mythos of Williamsburg is a lie, Diner is mediocre at best. The burger is good (a little dry) but there are better burgers for less money all over the neighborhood. Every other dish relies on the primacy of one flavor (garlic, salt, cheese) and is no better than a meal one could cook for themselves for a fraction of the cost. Our main critique is the pricing here; if you're going to charge $26 for risotto, we would rather go to Lilia (their pasta is $25). Sorry.

Diner has such a cool vibe. It's cool how they write the menu on your table. Consistent in seasonal offerings, the burger is a solid go to. Bar seating adds a different perspective that takes you back in time. I've noticed that the service has gone down considerably, but I'll still come back.

Another nice restaurant to go! My husband knows this place from his client and he took me here for a date. It very interesting how they just have a verbal menu and you have to very pay attention because it kindda loud inside, food is delicious and very creative. This place always packed and a line. I had been there twice and waited on a line about 20 minutes.

Everything was made fresh and daily down to their ketchup and mayo. Best white meat fried chicken I've ever had topped with amazing spicy coleslaw.  The kale was amazing.  Cooked and sautéed so well with a splash of citrus.  Their buns, hand made as well, were to die for.

Frist off- not a diner. Second- walked in with two friends and asked for a table outside and was told we couldn't sit outside because of rain in the forecast - but people who came in after us were seated outside. Then, while still inexplicably still standing waiting for one of the many open tables the owner was called to put the handwritten and hard to read menu in my hands. At this point I would have walked out but my husband was really hungry so I said we would just be getting him some fries and drinks for the rest of us. Once finally seated we ordered fries for him and coffee and I asked for the wine list. The wine list came so much later I had given up. I don't want to think the bizarrely rude and awkward seating was due to my husband and friend being black - but it sure seemed like white patrons were seated quickly and where they wanted to be. The fries and coffee were fine.
Best service I've ever had! Thank you to our gracious waiter Seamus for making this an unforgettable experience. To say I love Diner would be an understatement!

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY

column6: I was sadly disappointed by this place. The server writes the menu on the paper tablecloth which was interesting, but the bread was burnt and my poached egg was not runny. In fact, it wasn't even slightly runny. Between that and the charcoal bread, I won't be coming back.

This pains me to say, because this has truly been one of my favorite restaurants in New York over the past few years but the once charming and lovely service is just different these days. Over the past 6 months I've noticed servers are often over writing the menu on the table and throw a dirty receipt with the menu written out on the table. Brunch service is so bad that we all refuse to go at this point. It's a shame, as I used to bring friends, colleagues and family members there for almost every meal.
Love the atmosphere! The food is good and service is very nice. It's definitely a place for cheat meal. If you look for healthier options, you can go to their sister's restaurant Marlow & Daughter.

Best lunch in Williamsburg hands down. Diner's game is always on and the current chef is amazing.  SO FRESH. Love the fried green tomato sandwich with radishes parsley fresh mozzarella, I think they make it and it's perfect, AND aioli. It comes with a beautiful fresh and simple green salad. The wine list is so on point with refreshing difference in every option.
Cool. No me menus they write everything in your table. Great staff. The food was pretty great. Not your average diner.
Every dishes is perfect! Tried frog leg and it is delicious. Desserts are just alright. A place that I want to go again.
Expensive for what you get, small menu, not a ton of vegetarian options. Didn't like that the waitress sits down and writes the menu on the table, it's incredibly inefficient

Cool dining car with tasty burgers! The waiters write out the day's menu on the paper tablecloth, which is fun and gives return visits a sense of randomness. But the burger's usually on the menu, and it's on point.

Oh man, it hurts my heart to write this. I've been a patron of this place since I moved to the south side 17 years ago. Tonight may the last night I ever eat here. Having been many times before, I know how amazing the quality of the steak is, but tonight I'm afraid something was way off. I received a cold, chewy 8oz piece of meat, that seemed to attract the staff as if they were wondering if I'd be daring enough to take a bite. Not being one to complain or send it back, I tried riding it out for a few bites until I had no choice but to become my mother and issue a complaint. Well, typically at this point the kitchen admits they've overcooked it or that it sat on the counter ten minutes too long. Nope, tonight they doubled down and simply "heated it up" for me, which took ten minutes and did nothing. I barely touched it, which was obvious to the staff. they offered me a drink, but hardly an apology or a discount on the $45 that went off into the wind tonight. But worse than that, I feel betrayed. It's as if an old friend told me they don't care about me anymore. Except I had to pay to hear it. Farewell, Diner. You may not feel the same about me, but I will miss you.

Why the people like this place I really don't know. Everything inside so old the toilet is so stinky. They don't have even menu , handwritten for every client. I waited for my food 30 minutes at least and of they bring extra salty food. I had to return cuz I couldn't eat extra salty one . Even one of my friend had to return too cuz of salty ,wow. I don't think I will go back.

Last night I had a truly safe and delicious meal on Diner's outdoor deck. The menu respectfully outlined some of the Phase 3 reminders including keeping our masks on if not seated and a note to not move our table as to maintain social distance. Our servers were kind, quick, and considerate. The food was the real treat however. Myself and my two friends shared all of our dishes and while Diner is known for it's incredible burger we ate a superb light summer vegetarian meal. Truthfully, I'm not going out that much in the pandemic but this was for sure the best outdoor dining experience I've had in NYC thus far. Thanks, Diner!
Legitimately flaming garbage. The pork chop was at least 80% fat.  Possibly the most overrated restaurant in NY

I really used to love this place. The food is always good but unfortunately not good enough to make up for the astronomical hike in prices after they decided to remove their tip included policy. For a French toast, egg sandwich, side of bacon and two non-alcoholic drinks, we paid $60. In my opinion, you can find a heartier, better tasting brunch for half the price.

This was absolutely excellent! There is such a friendly atmosphere here, and when I asked a question in passing about the wine another patron had recommended, the bartender gave me a really thoughtful answer. Best burger I've had in New York.

I was really looking forward to having dinner here, we were celebrating an anniversary and it had the right cozy vibes for a rainy night but it fell short food/service wise. Someone knocked over a drink on our table and we were still charged for it without getting a replacement. Burger was super rare. No one bothered to check in on us and everything felt very rushed. A bummer. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

I was in the area and my friend was really in the mood for diner food. Which is how we found this place. We were in for a surprise when we walked in. The exterior of this place doesn't look too nice, but when you walk inside, it has such a warm and cozy vibe to it. Pretty intimate and dim lighting and the menu is served verbally for the most part and the servers jot down some specials on the paper cloth of the table. The cocktail list is very refreshing too. So much better than the actual diner food. At least to me. :)

When I first walked in, it seemed a little small and cramped. But we were sat in an area that was ok with plenty of room. The food options were good, a little pricy but portion sizes and quality of food was definitely worth the money. I had a really fancy pancake for $19 but it was huge. Bacon side for $10 a little crazy but it was at least a good amount not just like 2 slices. Waitress was kind. Would recommend to anyone enjoying a day in Brooklyn

A lot of people seem to love this place, but I was very underwhelmed. The food was ok, but nothing more. For the 13 bucks for the frittata I had, I was thinking they might throw in some potatoes or salad greens or a half slice of a strawberry or something. Or a coffee or a croissant, anything....because that's what I'd expect at a quality NYC diner. "Diner" is anything but, just a typical Williamsburg hipster moneytrap. Go somewhere else!

Not really a diner - or a restaurant - just a hip identity crisis. The food was good, but not worth the price and the awful service that came with it. Luckily South Williamsburg has plenty of other options.

My friend and I had the Wiener schnitzel, which was disappointingly tough. The dish's saving grace was the delicious and elegantly prepared greens -- a nice complement in flavor. The fava bean "hummus" was quite good with the toasted crostini. We also had a beautifully simple and extraordinarily fresh red leaf salad with fennel fronds and radish in a light vinaigrette. The ambience is charming with a warm neighborly vibe which ain't always easy to get in Uber hipster Williamsburg.

Awesome. Phenomenal. A bit overpriced in my opinion but if you're okay with that, then go. The food is so delicious -- our night's menu had the classic burger (perfectly buttery), pan seared scallops with white beans (some of the best scallops I've ever had), a buttermilk romaine salad (INTENSE but delicious) and flourless chocolate cake (it tasted like blended up oreo cookies with ganache on top. So rich)
Both the food and the service here were amazing. We ordered the burger and the pancake and they both were great. The pancake was huge and was the most unique pancake I've ever had.

We ended up having to leave the restaurant shortly after sitting down because of a schedule change,m. However, they had already explained their menu to us and were polite and understanding when we had to dip. I appreciate them taking it in stride even though we had just sat there and drank their water. The ambiance of the restaurant is great, a dimly lit diner.

Terrible experience overpriced mediocre food. Went with boyfriend. As soon as we sat down the waitress told us about how much she hated writing down the menu on the table and how humiliating she thinks it is (we did not ask) ordered a cesar and the bass. The fish came ONE HOUR AFTER we ordered!!! The people next to us were complaining about their plate having too much paprika to the point they couldn't eat it. No one apologized.
Horrible service - they charged me by USD 100 dollars over (basically made me paid for another table by mistake) and the waitress didn't even apologize!!!!!!
Love this place. Menu varies daily, and it's always good. The place is cute too. Just be prepared to wait a bit.

We were lucky enough to get that comfy booth in the corner and then proceeded to eat our way through that menu- which is the best way to do it here. I say get 4 of your food-loving friends out for brunch and order one of everything. The menu is so much fun! Things not to be missed (if they're on the menu): donuts, duck hash/rice with beef heart, burger, fish sandwich, and the polenta.

The food here was great... The burger was better then the one I had at Peter Lugers ... And the prices were definitely higher then a regular diner but that was expected .. I would rate this place a 5 but I didn't think the service was as good as it could be... And I went there when it was not busy..
Cute but I'm not a fan of an ever changing menu and the food was bland. Overhyped for sure.

While the service is great and the menu is robust, the actual dish falls short. Ordered the strip steak rare/medium rare and I was served something medium well. Apologetic and sincere, the lovely server asked the kitchen to remake. I politely accepted. The second go around, the steak came back medium. They offered another trial and I politely rejected. I'm sure it's a great establishment but unfortunately I cannot share the same sentiment as others do. It's just disheartening that a higher priced item on the menu was executed so poorly TWICE.

I ordered a pancake they gave me a cake with blueberries. They told me that was their "pancake". Its like they forgot the "pan" part of "pancakes". Its not called bakedcakes. The waitress also pretty attractive, didn't seem to want to work there and was never on top of us. Prices are expensive for what you get. The brisket was good, probably the only thing good there. They are also a bar? but serve coffee too. They should stick to being a bar because their coffee was wack, super acidic. And they don't even have basic Diner breakfast items.
Food here is always delicious and the menu changes all the time. I remember having a fried oyster sandiwch years ago that really hit the spot. I had a burger this last time that was also quite good.

Diner has gone down hill and fallen off the hillside. Service is rudely aloof. Lettuces for $18 was a large plate of radicchio. Duck tasted foul. Short ribs was a plate of fat. Gratuity is added to all food and beverage costs so the bill is inflated to cover gratuity. There are so many other options so skip this overpriced and overrated former hot spot.

I've been coming here since opening day in 1999. Every birthday, every valentines day, and any  day in between. The food is consistently amazing and the service is always spot on. Nothing makes me feel more at home than coming here.
my favorite spot to take visitors while in Bushwick/Williamsburg --- no reservations so you have to wake your hungover a$$ up before the masses show up -- no reservations but totally worth the wait

Absolutely loved this place! I loved the atmosphere, dim lights, cool ass service. Loved that they write the menu on the table for you. We stumbled in by accident and I'm so glad we did. For our appetizer we had sardines in a lemon sauce and crusty bread it was my first time ever having sardines. So good I keep talking about it. My main dish was the Char over lentils and turnips. I didn't leave not one lentil on my plate. My boyfriend had the grass fed burger with fries. Which was also very delicious. If you have a chance this is a must try if you're in the neighborhood.

So disappointed in both the service and the food at Diner. I used to love this place, both for the quality of the food and for the kind and effective service. I have to say, I will not be going back. Our self-righteous waiter, who reacted smugly when we did not recognize many of the vodkas the restaurant carried, took our drinks away before we had finished them, without asking. The salad of "lettuces" happened to be a plate of ridicchio, and I was delivered empty containers of condiments for my burger. The night just went from bad to worse. Then, to top it off, my friend's short ribs were all fat. Not one member of our party of five felt positively about the food. I understand inflating the cost of the dishes so everyone gets a tip, but when the service and food are so bad, there is no recourse for the customer, but to pay a hefty bill.

The food at Diner is fantastic. In my opinion, it's one of the best restaurants in the city. I've been coming here for aeons, and I've never had a bad or even a mediocre meal here. The service is attentive, friendly, and helpful, and I fully support the management's decision to switch to a no-tipping policy. I always recommend the burger, and there's usually some kind of fantastic steak on the menu, too -- sometimes I think Diner is a stealth steak house. And brunch, my God. If you like the food at Diner and enjoy cooking, I also recommend their cookbook, Dinner At The Long Table.

I don't really understand what is so good about this place. It's really not the prices are ridiculously expensive and what's up with not having menus? doesn't really make sense not having any menus the burger was ehh wasn't cooked to my liking I requested it medium rare it came out on the medium well side so I wasn't really happy with that they were nice enough to cook me another burger which I appreciated and they did bring me another one but it was still ehh something was lacking for me
Had an amazing brunch! Each dish was well prepared with fresh ingredients. Wait staff was very nice. Just a great experience and meal!
I loveeeee the burger here!!!!!! It's one of the best burgers I've ever had, and I normally don't like burgers. The staff is nice.
Overpriced; don't really see what the fuss was all about. There are better diners for cheaper in the area.

Horrible, overpiced food served with a grin. I don't usually write reviews but this time I felt robbed. The place is overall dirty. We stayed because we had good memories of other times, but is sad that Williamsburg now ceased to surprise for good things, and now will only let you down.

One of the best brunches we've had in the neighborhood. Staff was so friendly, especially TD and Max. Loved them, I would totally hang with those guys! A truly authentic Brooklyn experience- the Menu is ever-changing, they wrote it on the table for us. We had the fried chicken sandwich which was the best thing ever with the mustard sauce (OMG wow) and the breakfast sandwich. Really loved this spot and can't wait to visit again. So glad to be neighbors. Also, they don't have apple juice- just a heads up.

I came 3 years ago for the first time and have to visit when I'm in New York occasionally for the grass fed burger! Amazing! and if it temperate, it's a perfect sidewalk table/ people watching in Williamsburg/ experience. Love it.

Good food, but I don't love the service here. They copy down the daily menu onto the paper on your table, and it can get very awkward sitting there while you watch the server do this. The service can also be pretty slow, especially on the weekends when it gets busy.

Diner is a cute little place but has no actual menu so everything is told to you by the very friendly waitstaff. This is kind of annoying cause I couldn't remember the first thing he said after he told us the rest. I guess that's my problem... Anyway, I settled on a dish since I also couldn't read what was scribbled on the table. I ordered a ham and egg sandwich that came with chips. Everything was very salty. I could hardly eat it. I try to give a place a couple visits before I decide if I will go back but this is a place that I will not be returning to. The whole menu thing gives me anxiety ...

Absolutely love this place. We had no idea that this food was much more gourmet than a regular diner. The food was incredible, and the service was fantastic. Everything we ate was delicious. Can't wait to go back.

Food was not bad. Burger was ok but the meat was basically raw in the center and should have been medium well. It was also 18 dollars. Pretty high for a burger. My wife and friend had a sausage plate that was good. Neat concept with the menu but needs tweaking. Girl wrote menu on table and it wasn't legible. No prices. Name of place is a little misleading as far as what a diner typically serves and what they had.

Burger was great! I would have rated this place 4.5 stars and then I found a little piece of home! Green flash's West Coast IPA seals the deal with the fifth star! Though I'm from California I will return!

This really isn't a "Diner". If diners went by looks alone, it might be called that. I can't judge the food, I went with friends and only 1 of 3 ate here because the menu ( which does not exist, they write it on your table mat. Cute) only had four or five options , which none were breakfast. I would have settled for soup. Nope. BLT, surely a Diner has a BLT. No. So the one person that ate. She was satisfied. Of course I paid for the 1 meal and for ONE meal it was $60 , full disclosure she had a wine and I just had coffee. But still...... all in all, this ain't a diner.

I went there today with my family.  We did have our one year old son with us.  While they don't have a high chair, the hostess got us seated quickly to get our son situated.  And while they didn't realize that we were ready to order, a server eventually came to offer some options.  And he helpfully brought some milk for our son.  However, the server failed to provide any indication of prices, since he was reading out the option without telling us how much the dishes cost.  So we ended up paying 50 dollars for two sandwiches, fries, and a coke.  This is certainly not a place I would recommend moving forward, despite the relative friendliness of the staff.

Went there for dinner. Usually I don't complain as long as the food has a nice flavor to it. This place however was a big disappointment. The cocktails we ordered mainly tasted pure alcohol and were by far the worst I had in nyc. For dinner we had a cheeseburger and lamb meat balls. The burger was extremely poor considering that it costed 25 dollars. For $30 dollars I also expect more than two medium sized meatballs and some fried vegetables and a badly seasoned broth. On the bright side tips are included and the bread was good.
Really delicious and super friendly fun vibe great music and incredible fried eggs with mushrooms and polenta not to mention the lettuces. Yum.

Get the scone - no matter what type it is you won't be sorry! I had the biscuits and gravy - it came with greens and scrambled eggs! It was exactly what I needed for my hangover! My fiancé had the burger - he is a burger guy and liked it - not loved but liked - which is a good thing - definitely great vibe - not pretentious
The place is a dump but the food and service are great. Don't be afraid by the outside. Enjoy!

This is a fun, trendy, spot that is a converted rail road car.  It's small with no pomp and circumstance, but the service and food are great. There are no menus, instead your hipster waiter writes thing like "fish" or "salad" on the table while she gives a robust description of the preparation. The toast, salad and whole fish were excellent. I'll be back! It's perfect for a girls night out or double date. Not great for groups or an intimate date night.
Loved it here! BBQ chicken fingers were the bomb!! Very nice waitress gave us great recommendations.
These creative creations are made daily - and they are amazing. Really enjoyed everything I had. Even the mocktail. Service was authentic and awesome. Excellent.
Best spot in the neighborhood! Great place, service and food! You can't go wrong with it. I like it better on weekends that weekdays though :)
Great food, service and atmosphere! Can be a little pricey but worth every penny. Always a treat!!!

First time going to the diner and it was interesting. I came here for brunch. You really have to pay attention to the server or you might not be really eating. They do have a small menu listing about 4 dishes. But there's plenty off menu. I'm assuming they change it up? Although the experience was different I didn't find too much excitement in the food. I had the poached eggs and while it did taste better than others I've tried it also lean towards the salty side too.
Great quality home cooked food. Clearly take time to think about how they prepare their food and what ingredients are right for the season. Service is quintessential hipster.

We had an excellent meal here, both the swordfish and the porkchop were prepared perfectly. Good wine, charming servers, relaxed and mellow ambience. Pumpkin cranberry bar was a great blend of tart and sweet. I will definitely come back again!

I was really looking forward to this place the cool factor is definitely there, but if you wanna have a good meal don't come here we had the chicken, the fish 2 salads and the burger and we paid 200 for a very average diner. Not even the drink were well made. The highlight of our dinner where the fries, the rest was below my standard for sure I had way better meal for half the price

I mean, the vibes were better in 2002 when this was the best burger, vibe, and music joint in town. Maybe even one of three restaurants worth their salt back then. The burger remains the best in the world. I mean that. I usually have one at the counter. Brunch is decent too, I take out of towners: but yeah, full on basic brunch crush. If I am rich and feel like a meal to remember I dig into the menu. I've had some stunners. None of which I will see again coz the menu is always changing with the local ingredients yo.

I've been making it to Williamsburg more and more these days and places like Diner will make that likely to continue. Three of us put in our names and were called back about 30-45 minutes later. We were in the back room which is a little claustrophobic but generally ok. The waitress sat next to us and wrote out that day's menu on the paper table top. It changes all the time except for the burger. We tried a mussels dish which was more of a salad. My only gripe would be that there were only a few mussels. We had a mixed salad which was fine. I had the attic char which was very nice. The buttermilk sauce was not too thick or heavy. I tried the chicken which was good though it came with polenta which I generally disk like. My friend had the beef cheek which was good though a tad dry. Is definitely come back to try new dishes. Very reasonably priced.
Omg love this place! So cute the ambience is amazing and the food was so good. It changes everyday but we got the veggies and swordfish it was so amazing.

As a father of five, I have to say that I love Diner! They offer a rotating menu of dishes that have never left me disappointed. In lieu of a standard paper menu, the waiters and waitresses write the day's offerings directly on the paper tablecloth. This delighted my children! They were so impressed that they've been inspired to taking markers to my wife's great grandmother's linen table clothes at home to list and comment on the dishes that I cook at home. My middle son has used this newly discovered artistic venue to scribble long and convoluted criticisms of his father's preparation of Hamburger Helper, sometimes extending past the limits of the tablecloth and onto the carpet and up the walls. Now I know that once you have a taste of the delicious pork chops prepared by the wonderful chefs at Diner your father's Hamburger Helper recipes might be a bit disappointing, however my son's extensive manifestos extend far beyond the realms of food criticism and devolve into attacks of a deeply personal nature. Not that I blame any of this on Diner; in fact, our meal there provided teachable moments regarding not only the differences between disposable paper tablecloths and priceless family heirlooms, but also about the boundaries between freedom of speech and libel.

If you're looking for a diner, this isn't a diner. (Sure, yeah, I know - "Duh") The process the server went through of writing down the menu on our paper tablecloth as she said it made me want to stab myself in the throat with the nearest butter knife. We left right after she walked away from the table.

The brunch I'd ordered - ratatouille with two poached eggs and a slice of toasted sourdough - was excellent; very satisfying and arrived pretty quickly. I'm not a fan of having the waiter scribble the menu on the paper table covering, which I didn't know about beforehand, but has been Diner's thing since forever. Our waiter used cursive, the items had to be read sideways, and if you're a first timer they aren't easy to remember because Diner's brunch is atypical - very hip, and food combinations / descriptions can seem puzzling and somewhat random. Would you like preserved swordfish for brunch? Or are you more in the mood for a meal of peach cake? The menu scribbling and the menu component descriptions seemed overly precious to me, but the the important fact is the food is really good and arrives fast.

My dish (mackerel) was good, but for the portion size (small), not really worth $27.  In previous visits, I've had the burger, which is ok, but not really worth $17.  The hostess and servers and bartender were nice, but it's a little too hipster central for me.

Diner represents everything that's cool about Williamsburg, and none of the things that suck about Williamsburg.  It's privately owned, intimate, extremely high quality, cute (the building tilts west -- seriously), stylish, and fun.  It's not a haven for tourists, it's not a scene spot, and it's not pretentious.  The service has always been friendly and, despite a menu that doesn't read too differently from an old diner menu, the dinner specials are the type of fare you'd expect at top-tier Manhattan restaurants.  Add to the mix their sister spot next door, Marlow & Sons, and Diner is really a Southside powerhouse.

Food was fine, service was not.  Had to practically beg to be given the "verbal menu."  Do not go here with a child.  You will not have access to a highchair, but you will be given a heavy serving of condescension and rudeness by any of the staff who pass by you. (hey Diner, if you don't want people with kids to come to your restaurant, which you do not seem to, just write it on your website and we'll stay away!)

This is my favorite neighborhood spot. The food is always on point and the service is great! Their donuts are so amazing I want to cry every time I have them. I consider this an intimate, casual place to bring a date.

I'm writing this review as I'm waiting for my food to be cooked. The reason you ask, for a review before even eating the food? Here's your answer: I ordered the pork chop. Our waitress, who is fantastic, came back to the table a few minutes later to inform me that they were out (I had other amazing options, don't fret, like my go to, the burger). So no biggie. I ordered something else and took a swig of my beer. Ten minutes later the manager came over, had heard that I really wanted a chop (I did, I've never actually ordered one in a restaurant, weird right?), he had ran down the street to their butcher shop, got me a freakin chop, and ran back. Now it's being cooked. If that ain't service I don't know what is. Top of the line in my opinion.
Food is awesome! Atmosphere is old school diner-like. Homemade donuts are insanely good.

Love, love, love this place. Been coming here for years, and it never disappoints. The fries are incredible. The burger just fabulous, the drinks are delicious whether you come for dinner or for a Sunday Brunch. For those of you who don't know, this place has been around since before Williamsburg was cool and it's part of what made Williamsburg so popular. Andrew and his team have done an incredible job of maintaining the quality, charm and authenticity of this place and I will highly recommend it to anyone.

Overpriced for small portions, and, if you are going without a menu, write prices down too!  Hake was good, ribeye poor, leeks short on the key ingredient, pizza blanco--- huh?  What was that oily piece of bread perched on a bitter stew of eggplant and tomato purée?  All entrees seved with vinegary, room temp vegetable sides. Really there are so many awesome places to eat in the neighborhood, I would steer clear of this one, I won't be returning.

Couldn't ask for a better dining experience. The staff is superb, very knowledgable and attentive. The food is locally sources and always fresh and yummy. The cocktails are also wonderful, particularly the Manhattans. My husband and I go here all the time and never have a bad experience. Worth all five stars!
use to love this place. lately it has gone down hill - the prices are absurd, $24 for a burger before gratuity now that they have gone back to the old model of gratuity not being included.

Is it possible to leave no stars? I would have. Though greated nicely by a waitress upon sitting at the bar things took a turn for the worse. My friend and I were completely ignored after asking for coffee and had to ask for menus after about 5 minutes, which is a long time when 2 bartenders are blankly staring past you. Finally I was given a menu written on  POS paper while another couple seated after us was given coffee. I'm sure the experience would have been different had we sat at a table but I'll never know. We sought refuge at Rabbit hole near by. Always amazing.

Food, cocktail and atmosphere was great - easier to sit than I expected.  Menu is a little limited and changes all the time (and they write it on the table vs. giving you a menu), so not great for those with food allergies or picky eaters that want to examine exactly what's in it - surprisingly, though, most options were gluten free.  I'd go back!

So, you hear Diner and you automatically think, Hot dogs, hamburgers, french fries, and chili. Well, this place is everything but that. They do have a grass fed burger, though. Perfect place for date night, dim lighting, good music and ambiance.  Went here on our last night in the Big Apple and we had an amazing dinner. They have no menus, only for their Wine, Beer, and cocktails. The waitress explains each item on the menu. I forgot her name, but she was awesome, very informative and nice and great service. For appetizers, I got a spinach, arugula, lemon vinaigrette and almonds, my BF ordered artichoke salad, both were light and tasty. For our main dish, I got the Dorado plate, which consisted of white fish, lightly charred on the outside and moist in the middle, with white beans and a delicious, light sauce. BF ordered the Chappo or something like that, it was Pork shoulder with collard greens and potatoes. Both of us kept on saying how delicious and tasty their food was. The desert was simple and nice, a chocolate brownie, with walnuts and rye seeds and a light drizzle on it of something, maybe butter.,.. all I know is it was perfect!

We waited forever in the space the size of a school bus for a really delicious meal, not everyone at the table was as thrilled as I was though. We ordered nearly every special and they were all special.
